column8: The game is relaxing and enjoyable, perfect for those who love interior design and decorating.
column9: The snapping and placement mechanics are frustrating and inaccurate.

column8: The game has a lot of potential and is expected to improve with future updates.
column9: The game has numerous bugs and crashes frequently.

column8: There are some bugs and optimization issues, but they are manageable and expected in early access.
column9: The game is not optimized well, leading to performance issues.

column8: The game offers a variety of customization options for furniture and room design.
column9: There is a lack of customization options for furniture and room dimensions.

column8: The story mode includes interesting puzzles and tasks that keep the gameplay fresh.
column9: The controls and user interface are not intuitive or user-friendly.

column8: The sandbox mode allows for creative freedom and extensive customization.
column9: The game feels incomplete and lacks content.

column8: The graphics and lighting are aesthetically pleasing and add to the overall experience.
column9: The story mode and mini-games are not engaging or fun.

column8: The game is compared favorably to other interior design games like The Sims and House Flipper.
column9: The game is not suitable for realistic room planning due to restrictive mechanics.

column8: Players appreciate the ability to mod and the potential for future content through updates.
column9: The graphics and visual design are not appealing to many players.

column8: Some players have experienced issues with controls and UI, but overall find the game intuitive and fun.
column9: The game has potential but needs significant updates and improvements.

column8:
Kept my little underdeveloped nephew's brains engaged, but a really bad game to general audience of the genre. Developer doesn't even bother to adjust the price to the worth of abandonware. If anyone was allowed to go half cocked and sell rubbish for 20 dollars, a lot of people would be rich and a lot of people would be dying of starvation because of inflation. But thankfully people aren't dumb, so rubbish like this isn't allowed to be consumed and survive in this world and people will avoid this just out of sheer stink emanating from the negative reviews. It is to wither away and perhaps, maybe one day, some video game tabloid will write a useless ranking article ranking the 'worst steam early access games ever' and this game will be in it, making history.

But in the mean time, Kinetic Void is officially null and void.

column8: You know, I backed something like 50 Kickstarters, and only three of them ended up being regrettable decisions in the end.  This was not the worst of them--that honor goes to the guy who made some awesome t-shirt designs and then just disappeared forever the moment the campaign ended--but it was probably second worst!  At least we have a game that we can install and play, and whose space backgrounds look great, even if there is not much else to the game beyond that.

column8:
If you were ever curious why early Early Access games were so reviled, this is the exemplar.  I purchased the game nearly 10 years ago with a promise from the devs to smooth out the broken edges.  Ten years down the line, I can't say I'm holding out much hope for updates.

On the bright side, From the Depths came out in the interim, so buy that instead if you want to build a starfighter.

column8:
Bought the game on a promise.
Trusted the developers to deliver on their promise.

The developers never upheld their promise and then abandoned the product.
The developers should be permanently removed from the steam platform so as to prevent this from happening again; also the early access system needs more rules and regulations regarding refunds.

This game is the only early access game I ever bought and I have and will never fund anything in advance based on promises in the future, at the very least this lesson wasn't an expensive one.

[h1]Есть ли хоть что-нибудь хорошее?[/h1]
Нуууу, у меня есть майка по результатам Kickstarter с принтом от автора. Майка уютная, хотя уже и потрёпанная. Нашёл маечку, посмотрел на принт. А нет, это не от этого автора, хоть и на похожую тему и тоже долгостроя Drifter, то есть даже маечки нет. ☹

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]
Игра запускается в среде Ubuntu 18.04 на ноутбуке со встроенной графикой Intel® HD Graphics 4400 и это всё, что я могу по этому поводу сказать.

[h1]Обзор входит в список [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1103944566]Игры, Linux, Steam, обзоры.[/url][/h1]
column9:
Abandonware in the bad sense of the word.

[h1]Abstract[/h1]
Abandonware in the bad sense of the word. Do not buy. I run this game on Ubuntu 18.04 on a laptop with Intel® HD Graphics 4400.

[h1]Is there anything good?[/h1]
Well, I have a T-shirt from the Kickstarter campaign with a print from the author. It's cozy, although a bit tattered. I found the T-shirt and looked at the print. Oh, no, it's not from this author, even though it's on a similar theme and also a long-running project called Drifter, so there's not even a T-shirt. ☹

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]
The game runs in Ubuntu 18.04 on a laptop with integrated Intel® HD Graphics 4400, and that's all I can say about it.

[h1]This review is included in the list [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1103944566]Games, Linux, Steam, reviews.[/url][/h1]

column8:
How is this still being sold? This game had promise when it was still being developed, but Badland Studio hasn't been around since at least 2015. The game is dead, and still it's being sold on Steam.

Edit 3-1-2020: I did some further digging, and the story behind this game just keeps getting better and better. So apparently, rather than finish the game and deliver on Kickstarter backers, the developers wanted to generate revenue for a "side project" they were working on. 

What was this side project? 

A physical game store in Sioux Falls, South Dakota. 

I'm not even joking. This actually happened. 

Because of the *brilliant* choice to start a physical game shop in an era where online sales predominate, they went under and now that game shop is no more. 

So basically, if you bought this game, enjoy your abandonware that was used as a scam to fund a defunct game shop. If you kickstarted this, oh man do I feel sorry for you.

column8: I never wrote a review for this? Odd. Unfinished and neglected, much like this game. This is a rough one. The potential for ship building and design was absurdly detailed. Unfortunately it was nearly impossible to make a functioning ship. A lot of guesswork on the user is involved. The interface is fidgety and mysterious at best and beyond difficult to use. Everything about this game is an epic struggle, from building to flying to just playing. Kinetic Void is a disastrously difficult game to play, not because of game play but because of an interface beyond usability (though gameplay is no joy either). The graphics are vaguely passable but primitive. It's just not good at all, an extremely frustrating game-like program that will leave you very depressed -- there could've been so much to this but the devs beat it with an ugly stick and made it stupid. Do not buy. Kinetic Avoid.

column8:
船作れるって聞いたから遊んでみたけど全然作れないんですけどぉ…
アホな自分がダメなのか、もうちょっと頑張らないとダメなんだろうか…いや不親切すぎる！
何にせよ船を起動するのにめちゃくちゃに必要なモジュールをブッさしまくって
一つでもパーツが欠けないように完成形を成さないといけないっぽいんだが…
そこまでリアルにするなら
まずはお船の基盤となるパーツをつける→第二ステージで移動用スラスターなりエンジンなりつける→第三ステージでようやく武器とかもアンロックされて武器をくっつけて使用できるようにする…とかで
順番にチュートリアル的に親切に説明してくれたらいいのに
片っ端から数十個ぐらいあるUIシステムをまくしたてるように最初のワンシーンで一気に叩きつけるように説明されて
そっから一個ずつ記憶を辿って構築して、あげくガイドとか見ないと説明不足の部分はどうしようもないって…本当にどうしようもねえな！
しかもアップデート放棄して数年経過してるし、やっぱりクソゲーはクソゲーたりえるんやなって
ワークショップ適用するのにも何か上手くいかないんですけろ
UI覚えるので疲れたからぼくはもうこのゲームいいです
やめときまちゅ
おすすめしにゃい
column9:
I heard you could build a ship, so I tried playing, but I just can't make one...
I wonder if I'm just stupid or if I need to try harder... No, it's just too unfriendly!
In any case, it seems like you have to shove all the modules you need to start the ship,
and complete it without missing a single part...
If they're going to make it that realistic,
I wish they'd explain it in a helpful tutorial-like way, like first you attach the basic parts of the ship,
then in the second stage you add thrusters or engines for movement,
and in the third stage you finally unlock weapons and can attach them and use them...
They explain everything in order, like dozens of UI systems, all at once, in the first scene,
and then you have to build them one by one from memory, and then you can't do anything about the parts that aren't explained unless you look at a guide...It's really hopeless!
Plus, it's been a few years since they abandoned updates, so I guess a crappy game is still a crappy game.
I can't even apply the workshop properly.
I'm tired of learning the UI, so I'm done with this game.
I'm quitting.
I don't recommend it.

column8:
Oh this really pains me to do, but I have to vote this down.  I don't do this lightly, and it's not because I'm in any way "angry" that the game was abandoned.   It's just that I sunk a good few hours into designing ships, but bugs, crashes and generally broken gameplay just rendered a lot of that time a bit futile.

I'm not sure the game is all that fun to play.  It feels like a lot of time was put into the shipbuilding, and then right at the end, shortly before abandoning the game, the devs tried to tack on a small "galaxy" to explore and fight in, but there's little storyline, no reason to go out there, and  the graphics and handling leave a lot to be desired.

Kinetic Void could have been so much more.  If the developers had focussed on simple shipbuilding, and getting the gameplay right, this could have been another Kerbal Space Program. Sadly, it's been abandoned, and is missing a lot of what would have made it fun.   

So, having watched this for a few years,  I'm finally giving up on it ever being finished, and going to give it a thumbs down.  Don't waste your time on it. Play KSP if you want to make spaceships....

column8:
The longer Kinetic Void sits in my library, not even installed, the more I regret spending $40 buying it for myself and a friend. This game is the singular reason that games tagged "early access" are filtered out of my search results in the Steam store.

Apparently, the development team fell apart, and just one person was left trying to pick up the pieces and get a new team together to finish the game. As far as I can tell, they just ended up starting a new studio and pretending that Kinetic Void never happened.

column8:
In short? STAY AWAY. Stay away from this game and from anything else Badland Studio ever puts out.

I had such high hopes for this game back when it was put out on early access. 

This game in particular is the reason why I will no longer purchase early access titles. Sure, once in a blue moon someone will pull a Subnautica and see it through to the end, making a fantastic product, but why gamble on that when you could just as easily be left with the unplayable, boring, unpleasant experience that is Kinetic Void? 

This had such promise. 

I'm tremendously disappointed. 

It makes me sick to know I gave this project my money.

column8:
This game is the perfect example of what to hate about early access games. When this first made it's appearance, I think in 2014, it was a small game, by a small developing group, with a lot of promissing ideas behind it. And even more promisses were made, back then, when the developers still communicated. 
But, a few minor updates aside, nothing has changed at all. Not in the way of "well, there are still a few bugs left" - NO! this game ist still an more or less unplayable Alpha. But the developer sold about 125,000 copies of it, grabbed the cash - and was never to be heard from again, after changing the tag from early access to "released". You do the math, 125,000 x 20 bucks - that's something. On the contrary, everyone who backed this up was left with this mess. 
This is not one of those early acces titles where it just didn't work out. This is plain and simply fraud. And i honestly don't understand why Steam hasn't kicked it out yet. 



	[b]  TL,DR - Don't.	[/b]

column8:
DO NOT BUY!

I don't know why this is still available for purchase.  It's abandonware at best, a hoax at worst.  I picked up my copy almost immediately because I like supporting alpha projects - I had great results with Don't Starve and Seven Days to Die.

This is no Don't Starve, let me tell you.  Abandoned almost immediately, hasn't been touched by the developers since 2015 - nothing is happening here, and nothing is available here.  I can get more done snapping Legos together than I can with this stupid "game."  

Save your money and go buy something you really enjoy.  You're not supporting anybody getting this piece of junk.

column8:
I'd be lying if i said i didn't enjoy this game, i was one of the unlucky ones that bought the game just before development died, patches were still coming for 2 months after i bought it and i thought it would eventually become a finished product with actual gameplay...
Nope, the spaceship builder is all that you get, after you finish your design you can fly around through empty space filled with some basic mob ships to destroy, it's cool to see your built ships among them, but there's no quests, story, or any kind of skirmish gameplay to keep things interesting.
Which makes this game all the more sad seeing as the ship builder itself is really interesting and fun, there's just nothing but a void beyond that part of the game and i would have loved to have an open-world game space sim tied to it.

Long story short: No man's sky before it's time, with even less content, at least it isn't a fully priced title...

column8:
Suppose at this point it's beating a dead horse, but this game is essentially abandoned.


While it had great promise at one point, it does not deliver on it's promises.


It is NOT a living galaxy, the factions fight at random and you CANNOT meaningfully impact their interactions in-game, and believe me, I've tried.  A massive super-dreadnought wiping out all ships of a specific faction in a specific system, and the wiped out faction somehow succeeded in wresting control of the system from another faction.


The skeleton of a quest system has never properly functioned for me, and I never could make heads or tails of it.  Sometimes you get a pop-up telling you to do something at a beacon...then you do it.

That's about it, nothing has ever happened past that point for me.


The game is essentially a glorified shipbuilder, by which I mean you can make something that looks cool and is capable of annihilating fleets by itself...but that's about it.

Even the initial physics engine the game used, which had a promising mechanic of utilising newtonian physics while shields were off and space opera physics while shields were on...was ultimately gutted for an utterly mundane flight model.  You get to fly a boat, for all intents and purposes.


As much as it pains me to write off the potential to make this game something good, I must after so long without a word from the developer.


Please move along, there's nothing to see here.

column9:
I picked it up early and played it for a few hours. The building mode seems pretty good, but it's buggy in early. There's no French interface, which is a shame.
I recently reinstalled it, but there's no multiplayer mode, and the content is pretty sparse. The freedom of action is good, but it's a far cry from X3, even though it was very, very promising.
So yes, for some fans of the genre, you'll find what you're looking for, but I don't recommend it to Landa players.

column8:
July 4th 2013 this nice guy thinks, "I really should support tiny indie development teams...and this 'Early Access' project "Kenetic Void" seems to be off to a great start".  So I threw my money their way and felt really good for doing so.  I checked-in on their progress through the years until I realized that the fireworks display I expected to celebrate the completion of this project turned out instead to be a bunch of fireworks up the @ss.
They should turn this into a 'Fan Project', even while retaining all rights and owing nothing to anyone who contributes content.  It is sad to see a promising project simply die of Coder Burn-out or attention turned to other projects.
Just as sad is that I and so many others are now very hesitant to help such early development stage projects of small teams because this one failed to meet even the minimum expectations.
As is stated by every other review -- Stay Away -- Don't Buy at ANY Price -- but maybe you can find an 'E.A.' project with a team that could really use the infusion of money to deliver a complete title that meets or exceeds expectations.

column8:
Tags: 6DOF - Flight & Space Pilot
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Rushed out of Early Access. Broken. Buggy. UI would not allow me to interact with the game very fluidly in the garage. Small fonts and small icons. 

To be perfectly honest all I did was idle cards. I tried launching game but I got stuck in the garage and could not be arsed to read through the information overload of popups about building a ship. I clicked on the windows to try to get some pieces in but all the windows were blank. Maybe I needed to buy the parts ? The text was a little hard to read and the icons were small in the interface, and the overall feel of the GUI very clunky to use.

이 게임을 13년 03월 24일에 구매했습니다. 
마지막 업데이트가 15년 1월을 끝으로 더 이상 죶도 업데이트가 없네요..?
비슷한 게임인 우주공돌이는 그 사이에 행성 업데이트도 하고 지금도 활발히 버그수정/기능 업데이트 중입니다.
이 만들다 만 코드 바이너리를 팔아재끼는 사기꾼 새1끼들 같은 부류 때문에 얼리억세스/그린라이트 같은 좋은 시스템이 제대로된 기능을 못합니다.

제가 이제와서 이런 평가를 남겨두는 이유는, 이거보고 님들 사지말라구요.
이거 구매를 고려하는 분이 혹시나 없겠지만, 그래도 모르니 남겨둡니다.

절대 사지마세요.


결론

column9:
Don't try this!
If you consider this binary, refuse. It's the same as wasting time and money (even life).

I purchased this game on March 24, 2013.

The last update was in January 2015, and there haven't been any more updates...?
A similar game, Spaceman, has also updated its planets and is still actively working on bug fixes and feature updates.
Because of these scammers selling unfinished code binaries, good systems like Early Access and Greenlight are not functioning properly.

The reason I'm leaving this review now is to tell you not to buy it.
I'm sure no one is considering buying this, but I'm leaving it just in case.

Never buy it.

Conclusion: Never buy it. Instead, donate the money you spend on this to UNICEF. : The minds of the people who made this are fucking assholes.

column8:
After seeing some shocking posts in a few discussions, I've lost most of my faith that this game will become finished. Now granted I did have fun, but Lumber Troll decided to cut the project short due to "The well running dry." Now don't get me wrong, it would have beat most all of the other games had it not been abandoned. We've even had members who have tried to work on the game to finish it, again, because the community wanted to see this game flourish. He just didn't listen.

In summary: [b]Don't buy the game unless you want to be dissapointed maybe less than a day after you purchase it.[/b]

column8: Kinetic void sold me on a dream years ago, the first and only early access game I have bought it stands as a warning for those who buy early access. None of the potential was realised and was released feature incomplete, I'm sorry kinetic void I loved the idea of you once but you never capitalised on that idea. Do not buy this game, do not buy any feature incomplete early access game that you are waiting for more features in order to play. Just wait and experience the game how you actually want it. I'd give this game a 1/10 for not just being something someone slapped together in unity.

column8: This game sucks, it's plagued by an over complicated building system, and even if you do have the skill or time to build a ship, there's nothing to do in the open world. I've had this game in my library for a LONG time, and I mean that. It is no longer supported by the developers and I haven't heard of any updates... ever. I would say to grab it on a sale but I've literally never seen it go on sale. Only reason I ever bought it is a popular YouTube channel I watched way back when had started a game play series of it... and now I see why it was never continued. Too bad I bought this game back before you could refund things on Steam, because that's exactly what I would've done.

column8:
A sad indictment against the Early Access system. This game died a long time ago, abandoned by its devs. Worst thing is, it's now listed as out of early access, and has a £15 price tag. This is barely a tech demo, not worth anything above 75p.

Games like this are detrimental to other game devs out there as they shake the faith in early access titles - as there certainly are many indie developers who use Early Access correctly.

column8:
Very dissaponted that development of this game was abandoned in alpha. I understand that this sometimes happens to Early Access titles, so I'm not angry about that.

However, how are they allowed to take it out of Early Access and say it is a complete game? And why are Steam not displaying the real state of the game on the store page? At least when a game is in Early Access, it is made abundantly clear that it is incomplete, buggy and not necessarily going to be finished. By letting Badland Studio release it as if complete they are complicit in the deception. This applies to almost all EA abandonware on Steam...

column8:
i bought the game back when the construction had snap points (and am very disipoined that they removed them)
the game had alot of great ideas yet it is far from the game i was hopeing for when i spent my $20.00 on it.

the construction system is ok but could be far better if there were an option to toggle snap points, less odd shaped pieces, better size scaleing. 

the game play feels lacking there is nearly no objectives basicly biuld your ship and die by pirates manly because they dont give you enough starter parts to protect yourself.
the starter parts they give you in that poor exuse they call a career mode is a random shuffle of teir 1 parts and they give you up to 20ish components total consiting of atleast one command pod, one hull segment, two weapon mounts and weapons, one-three engines of varying types, and an assortment of subsystems.
it is slightly better in sandbox as you get all the parts in infinite ammounts however there is no point to play as everythaing is there for you to use alredy 


hell no mans sky is more complete then this.

if you want space exploration and construction that has a point... or at least more of a point DO NOT BUY this. get starmade or space engineers

column8:
Kinetic Void is a good idea that never made it.  There was so much potential in this game, yet it failed in almost every aspect.  When I purchased it in Early Access, I knew there was the possibility of failure as there always is.  That makes it even more sad that this game is in such a terrible state.

Not everything about it is bad.  There is so much good in the ship building, nearly rivalling the Galactic Civilization games in terms of level of customization.  The concepts the devs had in mind for the game showed promise.  It could've been a good Battlecruiser game for once.

But that's about where the good aspects of the game ends.  The ship building is far from being complete, with many, if not most, of the ship component mechanics not properly or fully implemented.  The gameplay is largely shallow and unfinished.  Almost everything promised for the players was left out, as if the devs decided to completely abandon the game rather than finish it.

Which is effectively what they did.  They decided that a game in its alpha stages was good enough to sell people and stopped updating it.  This game could have been a proper Battlecruiser-style game that was actually good for once.  Instead, it's an abandoned and unfinished mess without any word on why they did so.  This could've genuinely been good, had they finished.

column8:
My first Early Access purchase. Not a good one.
Bought it in early access when it first appeared on Steam since I thought it would be a great game when its complete. No idea why its out of its Alpha stage. At the current state it should still be in Alpha v0.5. Not even Beta.

The idea was great, the game was okay-ish, but incomplete. In the early days they had some patches every now and then, and it seems like the game was on the right track. After a while the updates stopped, and i stopped hoping. 
At this point I had bought a few other EA games and learned a lesson on supporting EA games, that is only support ones that is trustworthy. 
The game lies forgotten in my Library, part of me hoping it will be complete and a part of me wishing i could just uninstall the darn thing so i can have my free space back for a better game.

Just remembered i had this 'thing', uninstalled it and decided to give a belated review, so people would be informed and not buy this incomplete 'thing'.

column8:
Kinetic "Void of Content". The game was originally under development by four guys. Three of them left, and now we are stuck with an incomplete shell of a game that looks suspiciously like EVE Online without the "online". Updates are non-existent. Oh well. It was a pre-release purchase. Lesson learned. File this one under "zombieware" - it's dead, the devs and the game just don't know it.

02/22/17 - UPDATE - ABANDONWARE DO NOT BUY

column8: Don't let the store page fool you: this is an early access game that the devolopers simply set to 1.0 when they ran out of money, which was long, long before the game was finished, and certainly before it was ready for prime time. You might enjoy the shipbuilding in this game! Certainly some have, and it's got a unique slant to it. But once you leave the dock, there's nothing to do, and lots of vast, empty space to wander around in before that becomes clear. Steam isn't hurting for sandbox games. Don't waste time and money on this one.

column8:
I don't know why people dislike this game, so what if it has a slow development cycle: ONE GUY is all who is still working on it due to the fact that the others stepped out on him and he is actively trying to find people who will help and is NOT asking for more money to do so, that alone should get the guy SOME leeway. It's UI is a bit annoying but still useable and it's editor controls are some of the better ones I have seen. This game is NOT ABANDONED no matter what the other reviews would like you to beleave, so if you are hesitating on buying the game due to the negative reviews then I have to say just this: TAKE A CHANCE and just give it a try and in doing so help support the guy making this.


Do I recommend this game? Yes, yes I do.

Edit: Do not let my hours played fool you, I had issues running this on my old computer when I first got this so I didn't get much time in, now that I have a better computer I plan on putting in many, many more hours,

I got this game when it has just entered early access, then it was a decent experience.  Then it started to degrade, first it was the shipbuilder, then the UI, and finally the controls went to complete and utter ass.  Now this game is just a dead shell of what it could of been, and its pretty sad to see as it is.  If this had gone to a different, more compitent development team, then it would of stood a chance at being a good game.

TL:DR 
The first alpha build was better than this mess.

column8:
Game is abandoned, do not buy. The lead dev has had repeated volunteer offers from people to help with, or even pay him to take over the project but he simply ignores everything, after a few patches he abandoned his own game and essentially flipped his supporters the bird. He did claim to be hiring an additional dev but after months that person was never able to get in contact with him and he has gone completely dark.

He took the money he raised via kickstarter and whatever he got for sales via steam and opened a game store which he spends all his time with, leaving an unfinshed mess of a game to pollute the steam store.

column8:
The last patch destroyed what I enjoyed about the game.

Sadly a friend bought this game last year seeing that I owned it, only to find he can't even complete the first "mission" in it.

Yest it's abandoned, and Steam shouldn't be selling something that is abandoned by the developer, as that's a complete disrespect of the Steam community, gamers who didn't join steam to buy abandoned Early Access developments.

I hope more players let Steam know, and, should Steam not be receptive, contact the Consumer Affairs department of the Attorney General's Office of the State of Washington for it is too easy for Con-Artists to use Steam's Early Access model to bilk players and the gaming community on Steam of money intended to purchase games we mean to enjoy.

column8:
This game ran out of money and development has ceased to exist.  The game never got out of Alpha.  Just know that if you buy this game, it has no story, no AI, and no support.  It's essentially your custom ship flying around a galaxy map that is as pointless as this game is.

The game had a lot of potential.  The ship designer is actually quite deep and the graphics were not all that bad.  The studio that made the game just had a bad economic model.  Hire programmers to develop a game with revenue from steam and kickstarter.  When money ran out, the programmers ran out too.  The end.

The game had premise, it is enoyable for what little it offers, but I can not in good conscience recommend this current indie mentality of not taking responsibility for keeping your PAYING customers informed when the game fails and you have to abandon it.  Games fail all the time, you run our of money, I get that, but be a fricking man and OWN UP TO IT.

column8: I bought this game when it launched. It has not improved since it was launched on Early Access, if anything the updates made the 'game' worse. What's now worse is that the game is abandonware and hasn't been updated once in fourteen months. The game is riddled with bugs and glitches. The only redeeming quality is the music, which was outsourced to Artem (I believe) and can be Googled without buying this trash. AVOID. Wish I could get my money back. Too many developers these days take your money promising the world, then after months of excuses, run off with your money. Steam won't refund anything past 14 days so you're screwed really. Out of a good number of EA titles I've bought, only one (Project Zomboid) has been a success and hasn't robbed me.

column8:
This game is under developed, flawed, and broken. Frankly, it's gone from bad to worse through it's development. They throw out working systems in favor of new ones that introduce bugs that years later still arnt fixed, the UI makes no sense, the most interesting aspect, building is now horribly flawed and broken with menues that dont work properly, controls that dont always work or do what you tell them. Once you get out of the hangar and into the game, it dumps you into a universe that has no direction, with obscure and unintuitive controls. 

I would give this game a solid 3/10 for being a neat concept, but being executed horribly. Maybe another +1 for the decent soundtrack which is rather nice, but that's about all they did well.

Going on their forums is little help too. The community is full of immaturity since any problem you bring up with is met with "L2P noob" and other snide comments when you bring up questions like "Why did symetry stop working" or "What is that horrible constant scratching noise that wont go away?"

There are far better sandbox space games out there, dont waste your time or money.

column9:
It's an amazing game.

What's amazing is that you can build ships.
You can, but that's not all.

You can travel to other planets.
You can even land on planets.
But, you know, it's like, "So what?"

No, this isn't on that level.

Well, anyone who builds a ship and launches into space would think, "Oh no!"

There's no inertia.

Once you land on a planet, you know...

You'll have to see for yourself!

Oh, you don't want that? Yeah, that's better.

column8: What a letdown. This game has one of the most in-depth ship creators I've ever seen, and that part of the game is really cool. Then it got abandoned before the rest could be implemented or polished. Once you make the ship you can fly it around, but my interest was quickly lost. The combat and the universe and the ideas/mechanics are just lackluster, either broken or barely formed. The ideas seemed great, but ultimately you'll want to avoid getting this. There are other games that are similar that actually DID get completed. I wish that it would get finished, but it seems utterly forgotten.

column8:
No. 

Start setting is what is unfortunately quite common in certain Early Access Games -> a EA Game abandoned/Developer not seen around for a long time and then there was a casual discussion about the game in the otherwise quiet forums and topic was the games content and it's development history.  no flaming no nothing. just pondering over how things could have been and what was completed and talk about how to play the working parts of the game to get the best out of the game. 

And then suddenly there is a ban. Developer resurrected himself from the dead to just do this ban without a written warning or reason and nothing more. And then he returned to the bottle it seems.  No way to know what the problem was or chance to edit things. Just a permaban. 

No Ban reason just a reference to rules. Well read the rules but no rules was infringed - how could they have been infringed as the discussion was quite neutral and non-accusatory. No finger pointing or anything just talk about how things could have been and still a ban. And a permanent ban too. For good. For me this is the first time i have ever been banned in ANY forums as hateful speech is something i simply will not do. 

So i hereby use my right to tell people to stay out. I understand banning flame or hateful speech but this? No. just No. 
Just keep out. There is nothing to see here. I refuse to even comment on the game itself as it has some pretty solid pro's too but since this is the way things are done around here then just staying out is the way to go. 

To the garbage bin this game goes. Good riddance. 

Enjoy the money you got for this dear dev. Enjoy it.

column8: I really really just dont get this game, it started off really cool with a great ship making system, although they could simplify it a little since some of the buttons seemeed pointless, but alteast i made it through the tutorial that is riddled with typos and spelling mistakes (pointless tutorial by the way its basically like reading an instruction manual) But the moment i get into space with my ship im really excited to use im left wandering why i even botherd, the system is boring theres not much to do, the ship controls and movement seem clunky and distant, true the game focuses on customization but an "enjoyable space simiulation" I think not. This game needs some work for sure and most likely someone who owns a dictionary to proof read the game, not sure how a game gets released with so many errors, who ever made this should of invested in hiring some testers to work out the bugs and provide feedback cos this game is definatly in need of some work.

column8: J'ai acheté ce jeu en "early access" basé sur le potentiel énorme que ce jeu représentait. Malheureusement ce jeu n'est jamais devenu un jeu. Simplement un "ship builder" et encore, trop compliqué pour être un simple "ship builder". Probablement que je suis pas assez patient (pationné) pour surmonter cette étape de contruction de vaissau mais même après avoir poussé un peu en produisant un vaissau de "base" je trouve aucune profondeur (mission, exploration comabt...) au jeu. Depuis cette achât, je suis beaucoup plus prudent quand je vois la mention "early access". Selon moi, a éviter à TOUT prix.
column9: I bought this game in "early access" based on the enormous potential that this game represented. Unfortunately this game never became a game. Simply a "ship builder" and again, too complicated to be a simple "ship builder". Probably I am not patient (passionate) enough to overcome this stage of ship construction but even after pushing a little by producing a "basic" ship I find no depth (mission, exploration combat...) to the game. Since this purchase, I am much more cautious when I see the mention "early access". In my opinion, to be avoided at ALL costs.

column8:
Kinetic Void at first seemed to be a fairly promising title, I've been a space nut for a long time and am a huge fan of the older Homeworld series and the slightly more elusive 0-R-B Off-World Resource Base. So I got Kinetic Void when it was on sale for about $5, thinking why not, then the trouble started.

The previews for the game show very good graphics with a beautiful star backdrop and detailed rendering of the ships, but with the latest update at over a year old, the skybox does not render meaning there are no stars, planets look like cheese, nebulae fog looks like sprites, etc etc, though the sun has a nice lens flare. Long story short, what you see in the previews is a little misleading.

The game itself is still in development but had been on hold for a year now, it has virtually no backstory and not alot to do within the game. You can of course try to make the beefiest ship alive and go fight pirates, but that gets old quickly. Eventually you find yourself building giant flyswatters and pitting them against Imperial Star Destroyers if you dare to load up the game again.

Possibly the only thing interesting about this game is it makes fan fiction possible, who would win, the Enterpise or a Starwars Republic Attack Cruiser, the Serenity or a Varkrey, an F-16 or a TIE fighter? Truthfully thats just about what this game has become due to lack of progress.

Don't get me wrong, the game looks interesting, I'm hoping it gets better and finishes strong, but it's looking abandoned and in it's current state isn't worth the $20.

column8:
Picked up this game for full price during Early Access. Had a fair amount of fun building some cool-looking ships. An update made all previous work in te game incompatible with the latest version, so I left for a while, unwilling to repeat the entire building process again. It was barely, barely playable at this stage. I could make a ship, warp in, fly around, and that was it.

I cam back after a long absence, and the game has gotten much, much worse. The UI now looks and acts even clunkier than ever, the ship builder has become a visual nightmare of complexity for no resaon, the game itself still has practically nothing to do (if you're lucky, you might pick up a distress call - but good luck trying to do anything about it) ; essentially, it feels and looks totally unfinished in every regard. It's like the Marie Celeste of space sims.

So I started looking at the Behind The Scenes posts to see what was going on. Woeful mismanagement by the dev, bad use of funding and coding time, and staff departures have led to this game being, essentially, abandoned. this didnt come as a shock, but it was a severe disappointment - I'd been lauding this game previously, leading some freinds to buy it, and had been excited to see new features myself - only to recieve nothing in return.

TL:DR - do not buy this game. Do not support the developer until they can redeem themselves in some way (just being honest doesnt count). Check reviews and forums before buying a game, and for now, don't trust early access titles.
column9:
Picked up this game for full price during Early Access. Had a fair amount of fun building some cool-looking ships. An update made all previous work in te game incompatible with the latest version, so I left for a while, unwilling to repeat the entire building process again. It was barely, barely playable at this stage. I could make a ship, warp in, fly around, and that was it.

I cam back after a long absence, and the game has gotten much, much worse. The UI now looks and acts even clunkier than ever, the ship builder has become a visual nightmare of complexity for no resaon, the game itself still has practically nothing to do (if you're lucky, you might pick up a distress call - but good luck trying to do anything about it) ; essentially, it feels and looks totally unfinished in every regard. It's like the Marie Celeste of space sims.

So I started looking at the Behind The Scenes posts to see what was going on. Woeful mismanagement by the dev, bad use of funding and coding time, and staff departures have led to this game being, essentially, abandoned. this didnt come as a shock, but it was a severe disappointment - I'd been lauding this game previously, leading some freinds to buy it, and had been excited to see new features myself - only to recieve nothing in return.

TL:DR - do not buy this game. Do not support the developer until they can redeem themselves in some way (just being honest doesnt count). Check reviews and forums before buying a game, and for now, don't trust early access titles.

column8:
DO NOT BUY THIS TITLE!

This game in unfinished, and currently development is being halted on this project.
There are currently NO people working on this project who can finish it.

The game has been taken off of early access prematurely, as there are still bugs and problems with the game.
But according to the dev the games core features are done, BUT taking it off of early access makes it so people who block early access people will still see the title and might buy it.

In the devs own words.
http://imgur.com/yb8TKtW
"I don't currently have a development team and the programming is beyond my skill range."

"we are currently working on a side project in our spare time to hopefully generate more revenue"

Keep in mind this game was a kickstarter project, AND a pay in early access title.
Kickstarter goals and funds are supposed to be the amount needed to make this games a reality, but even with kickstarter funds AND steam release and money, this project has been halted.


I do not believe the dev when he claims this game is finished and no longer needs to be in an early access state.

I really do feel for these indie developers.
It's something I aspired to myself at one time, so I can really feel for them when it comes to money problems like this.
But the big issue right now is that this project has failed, sometimes projects fail, and you cannot expect people to cover your ass and throw money at you for something that has already failed once with the funds given.


Do NOT support this game, there is absolutely no reason to because from what the dev says this game needs those funds to continue on being developed in the first place.
Which means unless you have a few 100 friends willing to toss money into this hole, your money will just go to waste buying this game.
This game already went down that path with kickstarter, it doesnt need another kickstarter, it needs to be removed from steam and closed down.

column8:
To my understanding - this game began as a kickstarter with a Dev team of 4 people. As time went on, the dev team grew smaller and smaller, until it was only 1 person. A sob story, for sure - weep not for the Dev team, but for those who've already bought this 'game'.

It's still fun customizing your own ship and all that, but the gameplay is rather lacking, and there are a heck of a lot of features missing that were previously announced.

Really sad to see this game flail miserably and die out, but that's the risk you take buying Early Access.

TL:DR -- Nope. Take your $20 and buy something Legit, like Rebel Galaxy or something.

column8:
tl;dr DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.

If I could describe this game, I would. But it's pretty much unplayable, so I'm just going to describe something else.

When my dog poops, she likes to turn around and instantly try to eat it. I don't know why, and I try to keep her from doing it. Regardless of whether or not she successfully eats her own poop, she wags her tail with such great enthusiasm and joy that she makes me question my own existence.

Bought this a couple years ago when it was "still in development". They released zero updates since then, and decided to "release it". I'm pretty sure I'd have more fun eating my own poop than playing with this abandonware made by theiving developer. We should sue and get our money back directly.



Do not buy this game. 

DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.

Vamos a ver, aqui tenemos un verdadero caso de abandono total a un juego que presenta un gran potencial por una empresa inepta incapaz de trabajar como es debido. Me duele dar este analisis negativo, ya que el juego presenta un potencial bestial si se dedica desarrollo a el, te permite contruir la nave que quieras como quieras y del tamaño que quieras, para despues dejarte a tu antojo por el espacio destruyendo enemigo y viajando por la galaxia. Tal y como esta, y como parece que se va a quedar, te aconsejo que no lo compres.

Insisto, el juego es bueno, pero ha sido totalmente abandonado y ni siquiera esta acabado

2/10
column9:
Let's see, here we have a true case of total abandonment of a game that shows great potential by an inept company incapable of working properly. It pains me to give this negative review, since the game has tremendous potential if it's developed. It allows you to build any ship you want, however you want and in any size you want, and then let yourself roam freely through space, destroying enemies and traveling the galaxy. As it is, and as it seems it's going to stay, I advise you not to buy it.

I insist, the game is good, but it has been totally abandoned and isn't even finished.

2/10

column8:
Normally I'm interested in getting in on a game before it's considered "finished," but it's been waaaay too long since there's been any substantive updates (or any updates at all for that matter). 

There are a lot of folks out there calling these guys "cheats" or some permutation of such, and I have to say I think that's unfair. I don't think they went into this planning to cheat anyone. Lots of folks dream about making great games, but there are so many things that have to come together to make that happen, and sometimes all it takes is one or two things falling apart. That said, I can't recommend something this unfinished, though it looked like the vision here was pretty grandiose, maybe too much so? 

If it's on sale for less than $5, you might buy it, build some ships, download some modded ships, and play around a bit, but don't go into it expecting Elder Scrolls in space or anything of that nature. I've been in the market for a good space sim and the best I've found is Starpoint Gemini 2, (and even that's not quiiiite what I was hoping for) so if you're reading this, you might go take a look at that instead. Is it a low blow or improper to recommend another game during a review? Maybe? If through some miracle this game ever gets finished, I will absolutely come back here and edit this review.

column8:
[UPDATE] 12/4/17
IF you are looking for a game in a similar vein, try out Avorion.  They, unlike the developers of this game are competent and, actually have a game there and not some tech demo.

Crybaby banned me from his forums, like they were useful or something... Seriously Avorion is a pretty awesome game unlike this ship designer.  NONE of the other stuff is in KV.  It's all lies.
[/UPDATE]

Space Game Junkie says it all.  It's a 3D ship builder and well, that's it.  Dev is lazy. Burned through all of our KS money and what he sold through his own site to make a ship builder.  Now whines about how this is his only income instead of actually doing something constructive.

Bad 'game'.

VERY bad dev.

EDIT: PS don't let my play time fool you as unfortunately I was a KS backer of this steaming pile, and only checked back from time-to-time after it was on steam to see if they actually added anything beyond a shipbuilder, and well, not!

column8:
Depuis le temps que j'ai ce jeu, j'ai attendu ... Attendu les béta, les accès anticipés ... Pour finalement arriver à ça.
Une version finale dont le développement s'est arrêté à mi-parcours, glitchée à mort sans aucun fil directeur.
Vous pourrez construire un vaisseau bloc par bloc dans un hangar, un peu comme du légo.
Après c'est vide, moche, inexploitable, injouable, vide, vide, vide... Vous me direz que c'est logique pour un jeu situé dans l'espace ... Si encore il y avait de jolies skybox à admirer...
column9:
Since I've had this game for so long, I've been waiting... Waiting for the beta, the early access... To finally get to this.
A final version whose development stopped halfway through, glitched to death with no guiding thread.
You can build a ship block by block in a hangar, a bit like Lego.
Afterwards, it's empty, ugly, unusable, unplayable, empty, empty, empty... You'll tell me that's logical for a game set in space... If only there were pretty skyboxes to admire...

column8:
This game is the reason I no longer trust anything labelled "Early Access".
Seriously how have we as consumers become so accepting of paying strangers for a product that both parties acknowledge is incomplete; and put our trust in them to complete said product after they already have our money?

I miss the old days when buying a game is a single transaction of money=full product.

Game devs like this one makes it all the more difficult for genuine new indie gamemakers to be trusted.

column8:
Игра 2014 года, единственное что здесь довольно криво сделано так это скинбоксы космоса, по поводу самой игры она как и Азулгар дает вам возможность собрать с частей корабль своей мечты чтобы уничтожать врагов, из особенностей эта игра первая была на моей памяти которая позволила залетать на планеты и атаковать вражеские базы, игра имеет также довольно большой выбор блоков для строительства и в космосе довольно много уникальных кораблей различной силы. есть возможность добычи полезных ресурсов для любителей покопать и повоевать тоже можно и миссии повыполнять, торговли здесь как таковой нет к сожалению. но игра на тот год была просто уникальной, даже какой ни какой баланс присутствует. на замену ей пришел аворион.
Видеообзор https://youtu.be/SiI9qFpOwVY
column9:
The game is from 2014. The only thing that's rather poorly done here is the space skinboxes. As for the game itself, like Azulgar, it allows you to assemble the ship of your dreams from parts to destroy enemies. Among its features, this game was the first I can remember that allowed you to fly to planets and attack enemy bases. The game also has a fairly large selection of building blocks, and there are many unique ships of varying strengths in space. There's also the ability to mine useful resources for those who enjoy mining and fighting, and you can also complete missions. Unfortunately, there's no trading as such. But the game was simply unique for that year, even with some balance. It was replaced by Avorion.
Video review: https://youtu.be/SiI9qFpOwVY

column8:
Honestly, this is depressing.

When this game first came out it was rough, glitchy, not a full game. There was no objective or premise, but damn it was fun. Build any ship you want, warp around wherever you want with a giant battleship armed with space cannons!

Once the influx of money was gone all but one dev remained, did a few "patches" and made more "gameplay". What was a groovy game with a cool USP is now very bad for the following reasons:
 - Placing ship sections is hella awkward
 - Removing ship sections is hella awkward (takes like, 5 clicks for a single section)
 - Adding weapons, once again, awkward (many clicks)
 - Adding engines, awkward
 - Adding anything = very awkward, time consuming, painful, not intuitive
 - UI is confusing
 - Travelling mechanics & controls don't make sense anymore
 - Missions also don't make sense
 - Trading...how do you even do that?
 - How do you arm weapons now? What's the button? Why is there no guidance on flight?
 - Controls & help are outdated, I doubt the dev remembers how it works without looking through code

Basically it was good, and I'd love it if they rolled the game back to what it was. It was nice & easy to make a ship, fly out into space and blast some random dudes (who also used your ship designs). Now...you'll be lucky if you can arm and lock your weapons on a target after spending 45 minutes creating a pretty basic cruiser.

column8: Backed this game and it had a lot of promise...then, rather than follow a 'typical' update/upgrade through EA, alpha, beta, etc., they started trying to 'fix' things that were not 'broken' and adding convoluded layers to some of the more elegan/simple parts of the game, that were not 'broken.' Oh, well. It appears to be an abandoned project at this point. If you can get it for the option to build your own ship and fly it around do so on the cheap...this is not worth the 2$20 US. I moved on to Elite Dangerous and never looked back.

column8:
It is just plain boring. It is fun to build a nice ship and distributing ship functions but then when it is all done they dump you in a huge empty universe with no information whatsover.  So you fly around a bit searching for some sort of clue on what you can do with you awesome ship. But after a 15 Minutes of flying to places the realization sets in that there is nothing to do. Some ships ocassionaly fly through the void (what a fitting name for the game) but apart from shoting at them you cannot interact with them whatssover. Same with the planets. Apart from shooting at them you can't interact with them or the supposed people living on them.  
I regret having bought this game in its alpha state where it seemed like it had so much promise. But all that promise has been wasted.

column8:
I bought this game in early access.  Suffice to say that steam did not allow refunds at the time.

I found it hard to ever play this game, and now, seeing it in my library, I read the reviews to find that it might have gotten worse.

If history is to look back at why steam's greenlighting system is broken, it must include this game/developer as an example.  

That said, kudos to the game developer, because it is not easy to make games - certainly even this one.  However, this game is a perfect example of how an indie game can be overhyped (and overpriced), thus racheting up people's expectations.  

On the back-drop of so many other space games (and even the re-release of some classics) I see no reason to recommend this game.  If anyone does like this game they owe it to the developer and all of steam to explain themselves.

column8:
Anyone who's ever played early access games knows (or should) that this sort of thing is a possibility. Funding is a major problem with small developers, and many either don't plan well the proccess from start to finish ahead of time, things just don't go as expected, or they lose their minds and fall to stressors. Whatever the reason, we'll always end up with abandoned, or so called abandoned games. I've had it happen multiple times. I don't feel angry or regret it in the least. Because without the faith and support, we'd be missing some very nice games. You should wholly expect this when you see 'Early Access' and press that buy button.

This particular game? If you're nosy about the awesome ship builder, and it goes on sale, sure, might be worth poking. Just don't expect a game. Else don't waste the money on what's essentially a set of legos that you can only share with screenshots. We can hope that the developers return to this game later with proper funding, but I wouldn't get my hopes up.

column8: This game was an achievement when it came to building your own really nice looking space ships, and all the different modules, details and work put into that system. Bought the game in early access because I really liked that concept and there was some cool ass looking ships in the workshop. Unfortunately development seemed to slow, and seemingly out of nowhere I saw it on Steam's main store page being that it was fully released version 1.0, After full release I tried playing the game, and could not for the life of me figure out how factions or missions worked at all. It seems that all the actual gameplay elements were rushed out and are not user friendly at all. It sucks, and I know that's the risk of early access. But I don't know how someone could take money from people in support of a product they're making and on the home stretch just throw it out there in such an unspectacular state. I understand that if you run out of money and the game's not selling due to its poor reviews, you've gotta get a day job. At least work towards making it a fun and accessible game in your free time from then on! Maybe in due time you'd get a chance to redeem yourself and your game and you'd start getting some sales, but whatever man. I guess shit happens. Could've been a great game.

column8:
Very ambitious game with a *very* emphatic NOPE. The website still sells it as early access. Last update was over a year ago as of this writing. It states:

  For a while now, our biggest problem has been a lack of content once you’ve built your ship, and an in-depth economy    will be a major factor in creating a living world for the player to interact with. This week’s patch includes an early implementation that should give you a basic idea of where we want to go with it. 

So basically with the final release, we have an "early implementation" of a "basic idea" for the economy. I'm certainly not trying to be antagonistic here, but that just seems blatantly wrong to me. It feels pretty deceitful to sell a product as complete when it has clearly not been finished. I really wanted to like it. It was one of the first early-access titles I've purchased and I admit, the ship builder is pretty fun. Flying your ship, or interacting with the universe on any meaningful level seems non-existant. Combat is boring and janky, the economy sim is incomplete, and the whole thing reeks of alpha. For clarification, alpha as in the pre-beta stage, beta meaning the game is feature complete and only requires bug fixing, optimization, and testing. In essence I'm saying that things are missing. Overall, once you finish building your ship, you may as well just quit the game; it's peaked. That was the high point, that was the single most fun thing that you will ever do in this game. It's just boring. Obviously, no developer sets their sights on making a boring game. I'm not mad, I understand money and motivation don't last forever, but this game really should have been *so* much more than what is offered. The procedural random galaxy and shipbuilder alone must have been truly momental tasks to overcome. I don't know what happened with the devs (the forums are malfunctioning or have been removed as of this writing), but it's genuinely as though they just vanished. If and when they do return, I hope that they will learn from their mistakes and move on.

column8:
The reports here are crazy. It seemed to me that the community got spoiled from DEV interaction that they expected the world. I haven't played this since it's pre beta phase but what i noticed is this. Not only can you make just about any ship you can imagine but any ship you make will be ingame flown by npc's. So what i did is subscribed to about 300+ player made ships and guess what... some how they are floating around in the game world. You can decide how large/ how many star systems/ factions are in your game at the start, as well as do missions for them. but this seems like if your dream is to not be limited by developer made ships you can fight any number of different space battles.

I just wish they added the ability to buy/sell full ships in the store. That way someone who was playing the regular mode without infinite money and parts could save up enough to buy one of the ships on the steam work shop or even a generic basic ship without having to make every detail. That could make the economy more interesting as well.

Besides that I coiuld not look at my missions, nor find any fucking thing to do whatsoever. I'd get a message that someone wanted 17 of something. No idea who, or what, or where to get it. Just that they wanted 17 of them. 

Do Not Buy. ESPECIALLY not for this price they want. This is a terrible "game". Pretty space balet is more like it.

column8: 不要买了，这个游戏刚出的时候大家都觉得虽然现在有 bug ，优化糟糕，但是就冲可以自己造船这一点就非常有潜力，何况还内置了创意工坊，结果没想这游戏还没怎么解决问题就悄悄从 EA 到 FR 了，再然后干脆就不更新了，开发者扔个烂摊子拿钱走人没跑了。（论坛上有开发者回复：他们工作室本来就比较小，游戏利润全拿去给他们当这两年的工资了，然后还有俩人不想继续弄这游戏就走了，现在没剩俩人正在做其他能赚钱的东西，所以可以说开发者已经放弃这个游戏了）
column9: Don't buy it. When this game first came out, everyone thought it had great potential, even though it had some bugs and poor optimization, just because you could build your own ship, not to mention the built-in workshop. But before they could even address any of the issues, the game quietly went from EA to FR, and then simply stopped updating. The developer left the game in its shambles, took the money, and walked away. (One developer on the forum responded: "The studio was small to begin with, and all the profits from the game went to their salaries for the past two years. Then, two people left because they didn't want to continue working on the game anymore. Now there are only two people left working on other profitable things, so it's safe to say the developer has abandoned the game.")

column8:
It's a shame because this game has so much potential. The only thing good I have to say about this is that the ship creator is bloody brilliant. Real customisation to exactly where you want your weapons, cockpit, engines etc. If it's going cheap it's worth a go just to build a few ships and get really creative.
   Outside the space station though. MEH. There isn't really anything to do. If you're lucky a mission might pop up, and you're even luckier if you're properly equipped to do it. Icons of asteroids litter the screen with no real method of filtering other than 'HUD off'. and the game lacks any real.. anything. So.. Mining the identical poo drop shaped asteroids over and over again for money gets boring very quickly, and for some reason they just explode when you've mined them. This tiny ship can blow up an item that is probably kilometers wide.. with.. mining lasers. NOPE. 
    Planets are empty and don't even have names.. There's no one really to talk to, at all. Would have been nice to hail other ships even if it was just for trading. The little cockpit man that pops up every time you fart or blink gets irritating, just text would have sufficed for the 60th Silicates you mined. 
    After nearly 3 years of development I'm severely disappointed. Yeah some aspects are good. But it's not playable and it's not a game. What a joke.

column8:
Here's a really good example of why Steam GreenLight usually doesn't work as planned. 

Originally I invested in this game for the idea, knowing full well it would be a while before development finished. However, the stunning slowness and absolute lack of proper patching didn't even remotely keep me interested to boot up the game. The few hours I messed around with it showed promise, especially in the ship building aspect. Unfortunately, this is real life -- developers get lazy, lose motivation, perhaps funding gets cut. 

This is exactly why Steam GreenLight was a failure. In retrospect, it's a good idea -- sometimes developers need help or the extra customer funding to push their game to the max. Keen Software is a good example of how to do it; they engage in their community very often, an update is out once every 1-2 weeks reflecting some sort of desire or functionality customers wanted, and it is well-recieved and fleshed out to be a game of its own. Badland Studio had promises, but fell short; a disappointment of a company at best.

column8:
Kinetic Void started off as a really good idea for a game. 100% open world, pure 'do-as-you-wish' ship construction and exploration.

That's about all the good I can say about it.

The dev team was really small, inexperienced, and although they were pretty active in the community and media, the game itself fell short by many expectations. There are still a lot of bugs, no actual tutorial, ship building in itself is pretty complicated, and the game overall is not really well optimized.

When it boiled down to release I started to regret my purchase as despite the fact it's no longer Early Access, the game itself still feels largely incomplete. Buggy, no tutorial whatsoever, still not well optimized to run, and the ship building, although the interface is better, it still is really complicated a workflow overall. Not even the missions would work correctly. Which was a pain.

Of course, having already purchased this game I decided to cling on and hope for the best, but then suddenly, the game went quiet on all mediums: forum, update schedule, and youtube.

The entire dev team dropped out of the KV project, pretty much leaving only 2 behind. While it's more of a lack of interest than a 'take money and run' scheme (funds went to dev salaries), the 2 developers that DID stay behind, as much as I'd like to applaud them, can't do much either, not when they are also trying to work on a side project to make ends meet.

I bought the game with high hopes that were never repaid. If you're here looking for a space sandbox, there are other, much better games that haven't been abandoned and left to rot in the pits of Steam. Don't buy this. It was never worth the $20, and never will be.

column8:
Итак, перед нами нечто похожее на космосим.

Правда кинетик воид какой-то не кинетик, и даже не воид...
Разгон и остановка не зависят от веса корабля, может и зависят, но очень-то и заметно. Есть максимальная скорость, что очень противоречит названию. При чём максимальная скорость падает от увеличения массы корабля и от забивания трюма.
Камера вертится, если вертится корабль, что дико неудобно.
Карты нормальной нет. Нет инструмента, который бы внятно показал, что на каком расстоянии от корабля находится.
Вся информация о том, что игрок сделал с объектами солнечной системы стирается при заходе на станцию, и всё восстанавливается обратно, по этому мечта добыть все астероиды не совсем реальна оказывается.
Астероиды имют все по 5К хп. Что это значит - не ясно. Маленькие астероиды добываются быстрее больших, что логично, но количество ХП у всех одно.
Торговля - нормально, генерация и редактированеи корабля - нормально.
Почему-то инверитрованы кнопки вверх-вниз, что не логично, но можно сменить на нормальные.
Есть задания, но не много и генерируются они только в космосе и прямо в ксмосеи очень незатейливые. Хотя так и не удалось понять, как по заданию заказчику в космосе отдать ресурсы по двойной цене...
Какого-то смысла, кроме как построить кораблик в игре нет. Вообще нет. Играть дико скучно, ибо делать нечего.
А просто играться кубиками - можно.
Да, и контекстное меню у объектов почему-то рисуется ЗА ВСЕМИ объектами, что дико уложняет дествия. Да есть кнопка С, котора призвана выполнять действие "mine asteroid", но её дико глючит - если выделить следующий астероид и её снова нажать есть огромная вероятность, что прицел слетит с предыдущей цели. Так что остаётся только контекстное меню, которое рисуется всегда справа от объекта, и бывает вджруг перескакивает куда-то, может нарисоваться за пределами экрана, за HUD'ом.
В общем управление в игре очень не очень.
column9:
So, we have something resembling a space sim before us.

Actually, the kinetic void isn't really kinetic, or even void...
Acceleration and deceleration aren't affected by the ship's weight; maybe they are, but it's not very noticeable. There's a maximum speed, which belies the name. Moreover, the maximum speed decreases as the ship's mass increases and the cargo hold fills up.
The camera rotates when the ship rotates, which is incredibly inconvenient.
There's no proper map. There's no tool that would clearly show what's at what distance from the ship.
All information about the player's actions with solar system objects is erased upon entering a station, and everything is restored, so the dream of mining all the asteroids turns out to be unrealistic.
Asteroids all have 5K HP. What this means is unclear. Small asteroids are mined faster than large ones, which makes sense, but they all have the same HP. Trading is fine, ship generation and editing are fine.
For some reason, the up and down buttons are inverted, which doesn't make sense, but you can change them to normal.
There are missions, but not many, and they're generated only in space, and they're very simple right in the spacecraft. Although I still couldn't figure out how to give resources to a customer in space at double the price for a mission...
There's no point in the game other than building a ship. None at all. It's incredibly boring to play because there's nothing to do.
But just playing with dice is fine.
Oh, and for some reason the context menu for objects is drawn BEHIND ALL objects, which makes things incredibly difficult. Yes, there is a C button, which is supposed to perform the "mine asteroid" action, but it's incredibly glitchy—if you select the next asteroid and press it again, there's a high chance your aim will drift off the previous target. So all that's left is the context menu, which is always drawn to the right of the object, and sometimes suddenly jumps somewhere, sometimes even drawing off-screen, behind the HUD.
Overall, the game's controls are really bad.

column8:
This is one of those Early Access games that had a ton of promise, but was broken, buggy, and all but unplayable due to crashes and overall instability.

So, I shelved it.

Today I was looking through my library and saw it isn't early access anymore!  ...But the last update was about 5 months ago, people are still complaining about the same issues, and the devs have completely abandoned it!

This is one of those games that are case in point to be VERY careful about investing in Early Access.  DO NOT buy this game.

column8:
Cool concept, but lacking execution. Not the first nor the last game with this problem. Plus seems like the game has been abandoned, last update in january, and its june now, and the game feels FAR from finished. 
Feels like there's just enough content for this to be in beta, however lot of the features just seem unfinished, or just carelessly put together with whatever-attitude. 
Ship building, which feels like being the core idea of this game, feels decent, but unfortunately thats about it for this game.

column8:
Kinetic void, watched the video read the forums in very early access (2013). Realised that it had massive potential bought the game. Played it, shelved it and like many others waited for a better game to come to pass.
What Ive learnt since then, again like many others, I'll watch the video read the comments look at game play, read dev blogs and decide (usually correctly) that the game in question is just too over ambitious and throw my money at something else. 

Now the dev's are a smaller team this is one of the games that, personally, cant seen to be ever finished to the point where I could turn around and say "buy this".
The game is difficult to get into, difficult to play because it still is and possibly awlays be an unifnished product. Dont treat this as a full release (it pushed out of early access for many reason im sure).
Love building ships? (great looking too), Love flying em about with partially completed gameplay? Then buy it.
looking for something that doesnt require a lot of reading up on tutorials, bug workarounds and shallow gameplay then sorry, just look somewhere else.

What money I did spend on this game helped me save huge amounts of cash not spent on other early access games no matter how good the sales pitch is. So every cloud and all that...

I can only agree with the others, it's a disgrace to offer this unfinished game for almost 20 euros! Any old C64 game would be worth more together with DOS-BOX! As already mentioned, it's a shipbuilding simulator. After 10 minutes, you've seen everything. Period. Yes. THERE'S NOTHING ELSE!!!! Save up for another month and buy Elite Dangerous or donate to the animal welfare organization, then at least the money will have been worthwhile. You get nothing, absolutely nothing, for your money.

column8: Don't even think about buying this game. Why? Because it's not a game. Simple as that. It's a half brewed ship builder with clumpy controls and that's about it. No content, no meaningful missions, simply nothing that provides a reason to build a ship in the first place. I was shocked, when I realized that this game has meanwhile left Early Access Status, because it is still in pre-alpha state. This is not a full release this can not even be considered as pre-alpha preview. I had many disappointing experiences with early access (Hack'n'Slash, Spacebase DF...), but this isn't only a unfinished game like the others but a total train wrack. Or as I said in the beginning, this is not even a game at all. Don't let yourself ripp of and look for something worth your time.

column8:
It's not that this game is going to fail... it's just that there is better. Functionality is this game's biggest issue, it throws a lot at you without you having a clue what to do, there are no tutorials and the controls are awkward. If they added xbox controller support it could work though.

And yes there are much better games out there such as Starmade and Space Engineers. Kinetic Void is closer to Starmade but is kinda similar to the X series as well. It's great that they intended on melding the two together but it does need a lot of work and a lot more ideas to pull it off. Unlike Space Engineers, you can only design the exterior of your ship so you can't see inside. On the other hand there are enemy AI to fight.

Ultimately this game just makes you want to stop playing immediately once you have built your ship. It serves as a good distraction for about 5 minutes (add another 10 for learning how the game works through trial and error). I really do hope that the developers can one day make this game into something brilliant but at this point there is no point in purchasing unless you really want to contribute to the success of this game.

If you're looking for something similar to the X games but want more focus on customization, this game might interest you. Otherwise i'd say avoid this.

column8:
Backed this game more than a year and it was pretty much empty. I loved the concept and bought it. Came back a year later just to find out it's a disaster and the devs stopped working on it. Half the team chose to stop working on it and left the studio, and the two remaining devs need to eat so they work on a different side project. At least they are honest and told us why the game probably will never achieve the level promised years ago. At least they didn't run off with the money. It's about not having enough resources to go on.

Two or three years ago I would have said what I was thinking back then : "The future of gaming will be brought through kickstarters and indie inspiration. Big companies don't care anymore". Today, the situation has changed. Bad devs ruined the system and the trust we had at the beginning. A majority of projects never achieve the features promised during the founding phase and run away with everyones money, leaving the game in a bad condition. This has to stop.

Bottom line : amazing concept that never made it to release, despite the product being labeled as finished. I know this will not help the devs finish it, buy as it is today (v1.0.xx), it's not worth a buy :/

Bought it while waiting for X Rebirth. It looked promising but was so early alpha that it could not be played at all. But hey Early Access. So I forgot it. A long time after I remembered it and looked it up again. Looked a lot better but still felt like an alpha. I was curious and checked the news and then it hit me...it was the full released version.

To rephrase that: A fully released game looks like an alpha version. I was super enraged especially since Egosoft released X Rebirth just before which (for those who don't know) was nothing more than a "playable" beta.

I have not bought an Early Access game after that anymore.

column8:
Well, with 8 or so hours on record I feel like I can write a review on something quite a few other reviewers spent less than an hour on.

Anyway, I agree with the general consensus: The ship builder side of the game is very functional, and the Workshop is full of awesome ships (and mechs even!) built by members of the playerbase that can be downloaded for your playthroughs. (After you fix them - don't forget the fact that a number of Workshop ships are technically incomplete, with not all of the subsystems set, and often with far too many subsystems than the other parts can handle. Too many hangar bays is a common example.) The learning curve for the shipbuilder is kind of steep, but like I said, quite functional.

Outside of the shipbuilder, it's cool that you can set up a randomly-generated sandbox galaxy to mess around in according to some parameters that you set during generation - namely, galaxy size and number of factions. It gives a lot of play area, though there's no guaruntee your ship (even the workshop ones) will have the warp range to reach other parts of the galaxy. There are missions, pirates who nobody cares if you go hunting, and faction-relations mechanics - all of which are good.

The thing is, outside of that it just feels bare. In 8 hours of play I've only encountered "go hear and kill what you find" missions. I haven't delved into the economy or career mode, true, but no "sandbox" should ever feel like there's nothing to do - and that's exactly how this game makes me feel. Sure, I can warp across the galaxy into pirate-held sectors and go to town with a downloaded Star Destroyer or HMS Warspite, sure I can rescue traders from pirate fighters and kill a smuggler or six, and sure it can be enjoyable all the same - I was giddy when I launched in my downloaded Super Star Destroyer and found it to be larger than the space station it was docked at, but all in all I can't really recommend this game. 

I bought it summer of last year, expecting it to improve in time, but it really doesn't seem to have gone anywhere. Whether or not the devs are still working on it behind the scenes I'm not really sure. I am sure though that this game has huge potential, but as it is now fails to live up to it. Right now all it's really good for is destroying everything you see. While enjoyable by itself, it gets old when you run into an enemy or 6 using the same ship as you, and that ship is some form of battleship which had until then slaughtered helpless foes. Especially when those enemies are pirates. 

I have limited hard drive space, and I am afraid that I'm going to have to uninstall to make room for other, more fleshed-out games. I might still come back to it eventually, see how it's changed (if at all). I just hope the potential here doesn't remain wasted.
