column8:
Update:

Auch weiter hin nicht zu empfehlen leider :/

Stand: 8. Oktober 2014,

Ich kann Kinetic Void in dem jetztigen zustand NICHT empfehlen, da die Schiffssteuerung sehr schwer ist und auch Elemente wie das Traden meiner Meinung nach vernachlässigt werden.Die 20 € die ich bezahlt habe ,hätte ich auch zum Fenster rauswerfen können, dann hätte sich irgendjemand gefreut und nen schönen tag gehabt.Ich hatte daher ein schlechten Tag ,weil ich bereue das Spiel gekauft zu haben.Wenn ihr ein spiel sucht in dem ihr Raumstationen bauen könnt, viele Sektoren zum erkunden habt und ein gutes ausgeglichenes Kampfsystem sucht dann kann ich euch die X-Serie nur empfehlen(bis auf das neueste). Mein Favorit ist X³ Terran Conflict.
column9:
Update:

Unfortunately, I still can't recommend it :/

As of October 8, 2014,

I can NOT recommend Kinetic Void in its current state, as the ship controls are very difficult and elements like trading are neglected in my opinion. I could have thrown the €20 I paid out the window; then someone would have been happy and had a nice day. So I had a bad day because I regret buying the game. If you're looking for a game where you can build space stations, have lots of sectors to explore, and a well-balanced combat system, then I can only recommend the X series (except for the latest one). My favorite is X³ Terran Conflict.

column8:
Я давно ждал пришествия второго фрилансера или X с мультиплеером и возможностью самому собирать корабли, если девелоперы не пропустят вспышку и не станут выпускать МП отдельным DLC - это игра на годы.
Уже сейчас можно собирать себе корабль по вкусу и исследовать процедурно генерируемую вселенную, можно копать, можно не копать, летать над поаерхностью планет (пока бедненькой) без посадки, имеется  ОТКЛЮЧАЕМАЯ ньютонова физика, по-моему просто гениально реализованная, отключи щиты и согласно всем законам ты будешь ускоряться вплоть до бесконечности, включи и прощай инерция, но ты движешься с фиксированой скоростью и защищен от атак.
Пока в игре не стоит искать баланса, фактически это тех. демо и весьма впечатляющее, но все таки демо. 
Главное помнить, ранний доступ это то что позволяет нам - фанатам жанров, механик, старых серий игр миновать издателя, который запорол бы идею на корню просто потому что это не очередной Modern Warfare, это наш шанс дать идее превратиться в реальность, получить то что не выжило бы в условиях современной индустрии.. если бы не мы.
В заключение, если вы, как и я, любите X, Freelancer, Elite и прочие тайтлы что давали нам возможность объять необъятное, остаться со вселенной лицом к лицу, желаете увидев вдали жемчужину планеты, на черном бархате пустоты, полететь к ней и сесть в космодроме незнакомого города, и если вам там понравится, позвать друзей..
Это игра для вас, для нас. Я дал этой игре шанс воплотить мои мечты в сфере космических игр, может дадите и вы.
column9:
I've been waiting for a second Freelancer or X with multiplayer and the ability to build your own ships for a long time, if the developers don't miss the boat and release MP as separate DLC—this is a game for years to come.

Even now, you can build your own ship and explore the procedurally generated universe. You can mine or not, fly over the planetary surfaces (poor ones for now) without landing. There's SWITCHABLE Newtonian physics, which I think is simply brilliantly implemented. Turn off the shields, and according to all the laws, you'll accelerate to infinity. Turn them on, and goodbye to inertia, but you'll move at a fixed speed and be protected from attacks.
There's no need to look for balance in the game yet; it's essentially a tech demo, and a very impressive one at that, but still a demo.
The main thing to remember is that Early Access allows us—fans of genres, mechanics, and old series—to bypass a publisher that would have killed the idea at the outset simply because it's not another Modern Warfare. It's our chance to turn an idea into reality, to create something that wouldn't have survived in the modern industry if not for us.

In conclusion, if you, like me, love X, Freelancer, Elite, and other titles that gave us the opportunity to embrace the immensity, to be face-to-face with the universe, to see a distant pearl of a planet, on the black velvet of the void, to fly to it and land in the spaceport of an unfamiliar city, and if you like it, invite your friends...

This game is for you, for us. I gave this game the chance to realize my dreams of space games, and maybe you will too.

column8: Though it had a slow start - the growth of this game is amazing. It has gone from being one of the best ship building experiences to actually forging a world that you can take that ship and become someone in the galaxy, and the updates seem to actually have momentum to them. Graphics for an indie game are amazing, and the effort the team puts into it is extraordinary.

column8:
Excellent custom ship builder. Though the sub-systems are a bit tricky to locate. Space is big, open, and empty. Ship to ship combat seems ok, though the trading aspect is a bit confusing. Controls and UI not too terrible, though some further explanation or a tutorial would greatly improve things.

Could use a better mission system. Repeatedly saw messages pop up without any way to know where the mission was, or who the target was. Only missions seem to be combat based. Planet based stations would be a nice addition, though maybe I just didn't find any.

Overall, this is a fun game, but I don't see myself spending a great deal of time on it as it is.

column8:
Fun game, great developer.  I can't recommend the game in its current state unless you really want to fund development.

Not gonna try to sell a game on hype and 'potential', especially after StarForge's debacle.  However, unlike CodeHatch, Badland Studios is very open, communicative, and engages with their community.

So, yeah. It's not done yet, and won't be for a long while, but it's heading in a good direction, and it's already fun to just build the ships in the hangar.  Being able to take them out and fight with them is a bonus.  Worth twenty bucks? Not yet, but check back in a few months.

Edit: Well, I was wrong!  It's 'done', but the developers are still planning to add more content.  Can't ask for much more than that, can ya?  Gonna be redoing my review later after I play it a bit.

Edit 2: It's done..and..there's been no more content.  Not in any meaningful sense. I'm sad, but not disheartened.

column8:
Even for an early access game Kinetic Void offers solid game play with consitant updates by the developers. I've spent most of the time just building different ships in the game. The amount of detail allowed in customizing the ship can be staggering. You place hull parts and engines, fill those with subsystems that affect the ship in different ways. 

Currently you can take it out and fly around, shoot other ships or mine. There are also factions in game that you can do missions for that are generated for you as you are out in space. Newtonian physics as an option adds a great layer to the flight. Nothing better than strafing around at high speeds while in a dog fight. At this stage I can whole heartedly recommend this purchase, especially with devs that respond to the community.

column8:
This game is in Early Alpha stage. So I took that in consideration and looked in the long run. Not just as to what it offers at the moment. 


Kinetic Void is a new genre of Spaceship Simulator. Having it's roots from the old freelancer and other games from the genre, it bring us new aspects of the game. Creating your own ship.

Kinetic void let the players create their own ships, the way they want. You are able to design and create the ships you want for any purpose that may suite you. Want a nice looking sleek ship? Go ahead and make one. Want a big though ship like the Galactica? Go Ahead. And when we talk about creating ship, the Devs have gone further then just looks. All of the ship needs, from the power to radars, to crew quarters are your to choice to decide where they go. And to protect these important systems is one of your goal. Having, technically, no limits, you can build any ship you would have though about. 

But creating ships is not the only aspect. If this is something that is not your taste, you can simply take some of the default ship, or why not download some designs from the community workshop? Having over  thousands of community created ships, there is a ship for everyone out there... If designing is not your taste. 

Kinetic void launches you in a Procedural Generation world where Factions of NPCs each struggling to survive and conquer the galaxy in their own own. You are sent in this sandbox word with one goal: Living your life how  you want it. You want to be a merchant, selling Goods around the universe? Go ahead. Want to be a smuggler and go past blockades? Want to just shoot at things and be a pirate? Or defend the innocent? All is yours to decide. 


Kinetic Void aims to  be one of the, if not the space sim with the most opened up world, with the most customized game possible and it does it in a way that makes  you wonder: Why no one though of this before? 


If you are a fan of any space ship simulator, Kinetic Void is a must. From it's amazing artwork, to the infinity of customization, to the hard work of the Team, there's absolutely no reason not to have this game.

column8:
Note that this review is written and submitted for a currently unfinished game(as of September 10th 2014), and that anything therein is subject to change.

Kinetic Void is a pretty decent looking space simulator with a lot of potential and a small but dedicated development team. I figure that the easiest way to review the game is to just list off a few of the more notable pros an cons as they are at the time of writing this review.

PROS:

-The game has a fairly robust ship creator/editor that allows you to make some really interesting and complex stuff if you sit down and practice a bit
-The player has a good amount of control over various aspects of both their ship and their way of spacefaring. Controls are fluid, weapons are responsive, and the game supports both keyboard and mouse control of the player's ship.
-It was interesting to learn that ship designs you save can potentially be used by NPCs, including enemies.
-The development team takes their time with updates, but is extremely consistent and dedicated in their work. New content might take a while, but I've never felt that the game has been abandoned by the devs like so many other early access titles.

CONS:

-Being early-access, there are still a number of bugs and other assorted issues to be ironed out. You're accepting that fact by purchasing the game in an incomplete state
-Space is almost realistically a bit too empty a lot of the time. I'd really like to see the number and variety of structures in each system increased
-Currently the variety of parts in the game is fairly large, but all parts are locked to one of five size classes, meaning that it can sometimes be difficult to make attractive ships, mainly smaller craft like fighters and interceptors.
-The game has little in the way of missions or goals. You're dropped in and expected to find your way around the vast expanse of space on your own. This will most likely be fixed later, but hey, that's life, you know?


Overall, I'd recommed this game to a friend if I knew that they were interested in a space sim that will eventually be very in-depth and detailed. Right now the game is still very lacking in features, but I have faith in the dev team to complete Kinetic Void, and the amount of content and bug fixes increases with every update.

column8:
Let's compare my first review to that of my current, shall we? Just about 0% of this game's previous playerbase now still has anything positive to say about this game, so my voice is just a drop in the bucket... But I realized I needed to edit this.

- - - - - (Old Review) - - - - -

This game is amazing. Hands down the most fun in a space game I've had in a long time.

What I like about it is the sheer massiveness of the things you can create and the massiveness of the galaxies you can explore.
I've also found out that you can create your own factions, and if you wanted to, delete the starters and make all custom ones that have their own unique ships and all.

If you're into space or large-scale wars or both, look into it. It won't disappoint.

- - - - - (New Review) - - - - -

The game has been dead since January 2015. The developer, "Badlands Studios," is now some stupid game retail store somewhere in the US, owned by "LumberingTroll" (aka Sean Pollman) I suppose... But it's been almost a year since last I even looked at this game's page.

Let's pray that these developers never live this embarrassment down - no group of coders who took advantage of hopeful fans so disgustingly should ever create games again. They released a massive list of planned features they intended to implement before suddenly (disregarding? ignoring? re-writing?) this list and passing their half-baked - no, too kind - utterly broken and pathetic project of a game as "complete" and then abandoning it after two or three further bug-fixing updates. ...which didn't even scratch the surface of what all was wrong with it. They took their money and split. Never in my life have I felt so horribly cheated, and it was only what, $20?

I couldn't sit and let my once-positive review sit and be seen by other poor folk... So, here it is, over a year later. If anyone else ever sees this, you be sure and avoid any game that has Sean Pollman or "LumberingTroll" and friends listed as developers. You'll thank me later.

column8:
I have very much enjoyed my experience in Kinetic Void thus far.  Currently, it reminds me of much of Digital Anvil/Microsoft Studio's Freelancer - a game I VERY much enjoyed for providing a rich, detailed universe.  Freelancer also had a wide range of systems and paths that a player could take, and allowed for customizable ships.

Kinetic Void ups the ship design aspect allowing for a completely customizable ship.  Runner, gunner, fighter, freighter...  armed to the teeth or built for speed - or ANYTHING in between.  Build a galaxy to play in.

There's a lot to see and do within the game, and I think having access to the design creativity of the Steam-going public as well as a talented design team will provide an excellent experience.

column8:
我倒是没想到过也有一天能给抢先体验写评测。
咱一直对科幻，太空类游戏抱有好感，毕竟这一类游戏经常会和自由度这一重要要素相联系。不论是太空开飞机突突突的自由枪骑兵，或者是玩家在下一盘很大的棋的太空帝国，银河文明，到时间比较近的无尽空间，都会或多或少带有自由度这一要素。而其中跟太空关系最紧密的自由度体现点，要算是舰船的自定义了。
这个游戏便是建立在自主设计太空船的基础之上的一个游戏。就我现在这点游戏时间能够接触到的内容来看，舰船的自定义功能也算是有板有眼。话说在进行舰船自行设计的过程中，我倒是明显有感觉，舰船的设计方式的思路（是设计方式），或者说设计时的操作方式，有很多地方和坎巴拉太空计划很像，后者是自行设计航空航天器并将其发射升空的游戏，各位估计也知道。
另外，游戏说的是设计太空船，我要说，游戏诚不我欺，因为设计出的东西确确实实是笨重的太空船，操作不骗人系列。不管怎么压缩，体积也都摆在那里了，如果想设计个自由枪骑兵里的小型单人飞船，那是想多了（那玩意儿最多跟家园里的战机护航艇一个级别，这里则真的是战舰）。
基本除了设计飞船以外，要说游戏乐趣也就剩下在太空里到处跑做些[spoiler] 羞羞的事情 [/spoiler]能在其他游戏都很常见的事情了。那我是不是可以理解为，主角是飞船的模拟人生呢（笑
相比前段时间的太空工程师，玩家亲自扮演一个工程师来设计飞船，这个游戏则相当于是从更加宏观的角度让玩家设计飞船，所以相对的模块化的物品也就更大，换句话说，这个游戏更可以说是拼凑一个模型手办，模型手办用哪些手脚，玩家决定。而太空工程师，那就是玩家在玩一个太空版的MC了。因为售价，我于是很自然就把这两者拿来比较，当然，对于谁好谁坏这种问题是没有定论的。
这类想要强调自由度的游戏一般在画面等等其它方面会做得比较差，本游戏就是这样，画面说不得好，音乐算是一般，至少还是能体现出太空的感觉。。即使是考虑这是一个抢先体验游戏，但也能猜到，最终游戏的画面就算有改进，也会很有限。想想看无尽空间，在将舰船设计压缩为简单的“加buff”之后，换一个较好的画面，自由度方面的表现就会让人觉得诚意不足。[strike] 就算是家园2升级个子模块也知道改模型啊喂…… [/strike]所以玩这类游戏就要先抱有忽略画面的觉悟。
另一个所谓的弊病是对中文而言的，由于是太空题材游戏，英文肯定会相对其它英文游戏来说理解更有难度，想象看坎巴拉太空计划那一堆英文就明白了。我要说，其实就算是中文，对于没有接触过太空知识的玩家来说，坎巴拉也不一定能玩，那么多词如果中文都不知道意思怎么玩？只能是堆失败经验总结。而本游戏的英文难度相对坎巴拉来说低一点，但也能让人有些头大。因为除了词语意思难不难以外，文本量也是个让人头大的问题啊…………
最后，游戏打折75off入手表示不坏。
column9:
I never thought I'd get to review an Early Access game.
I've always had a fondness for sci-fi and space games, after all, they often rely on the crucial element of freedom. Whether it's the freelancers flying planes and shooting around in space, or the grand chess game of Space Empire and Galactic Civilization, or the more recent Endless Space, all of them incorporate this element of freedom to some degree. The most relevant manifestation of this freedom in space is ship customization.
This game is built around the concept of customizing your own spaceships. From what I've been able to play with so far, the ship customization features are quite well-organized. While designing my own ship, I felt a distinct resemblance between the design process (or rather, the design method), or the control methods involved in designing it, to Kerbal Space Program, a game where you design and launch your own spacecraft, as you're probably familiar with. Furthermore, the game talks about designing spaceships, and I have to say, the game doesn't lie, as the designs I get are indeed bulky spaceships, and the controls don't lie. No matter how you compress it, the size is there. If you're thinking of designing a small, single-person ship like in Free Lancer, you're overthinking it (those are at most on the same level as the fighter escort craft in Homeworld, while here you're actually a battleship).
Besides designing the ships, the fun of the game is basically just running around in space doing [spoiler] embarrassing things [/spoiler] that are common in other games. So, can I interpret this as the protagonist being a spaceship sim? (Laughs)

Compared to the recent Space Engineers, where players personally assumed the role of an engineer designing a spaceship, this game takes a more macro perspective, so the modularity of the items is relatively large. In other words, this game is more like piecing together a model figurine, with the player deciding which parts to use. Space Engineers, on the other hand, is like playing a space version of MC. Because of the price, I naturally compared the two. Of course, there's no definitive answer as to which is better.

Games that emphasize freedom generally fall short in other areas like graphics, and this game is a case in point. The graphics aren't great, and the music is average, but at least it manages to capture the feeling of space. Even considering this is an Early Access game, it's reasonable to assume that any improvements to the final game's graphics will be limited. Think of Endless Space: after compressing ship design into a simple "add buff" mode, replacing it with better graphics would make the freedom feel less than genuine. [strike] Even upgrading a submodule in Homeworld 2 requires changing the model... [/strike] So, when playing this kind of game, you have to be prepared to ignore the graphics.

Another so-called drawback is in the Chinese language. Since it's a space-themed game, the English is definitely more difficult to understand than other English-language games. Just imagine the overwhelming amount of English in Kerbal Space Program. I'd say, even in Chinese, Kerbal might not be playable for players without any prior space experience. How can you play without knowing the meaning of so many words in Chinese? You can only rely on experience gained from failures. While the English version of this game is a bit less difficult than Kerbal, it can still be a bit daunting. Besides the difficulty of the words, the sheer volume of text is also a major issue...

Finally, the 75% off discount on the game isn't bad.

column8:
I only have a couple of hours on this game so far, and those hours were purely from me painstakingly putting together my space ship.

Having said that, I had an unbelievably good time doing so.  Even if the gameplay turns out to only be so-so, I'll still consider this money well spent.  The ship construction is incredibly good, both simple (though it takes some trial and error to figure out the eccentricities) and complex enough to satisfy... well... someone who has spent hours building a single ship.
Something else that blew me away is the soundtrack!  I was nervous when the first track ended (mere minutes into my shipbuilding exploration!) that it would just repeat.  Nope!  Although tracks did repeat over my multi-hour session, there were enough and I enjoyed every single one so much that I was entertained the entire time.

In sum, based on a couple of hours of gameplay; a fantastic ship builder and gorgeous soundtrack make me think this may join my list of all-time favorite games.

column8: Építs űrhajót! Aztán építs újat, és megint egyet! Fightert vagy destroyert, adj hozzá képességeket(pajzsok, reaktorok, raktér), és irány az űr! Aztán építsd át a hajódat, adj neki más színeket, nagyobb hajtóművet, nagyobb fegyvereket, erősebb pajzsokat. Aztán építs egy újat! :D Aztán irány az űr, lépj be a hipertérbe, lőj le minden ellenséget, nézz körül bolygókon, vagy csak nézd a gyönyörű környezetet, a napokat, gázfelhőket, és a felrobbanó ellenséges gépeket, használd az ugró kapukat, menekülj el a túlerő elől.

Çok gelişmesi lazım, en temelinden oynanış olsun kontroller olsun çok zor hatta saçma, gelişimine göre degerlendirilebilir her ay en az 3 tane orta derecede (50mb-250mb (genelde 2 ufak 1 genis kapsamlı oluyor) ) update çıkartıyorlar büyük ölcüde bug kalmadı diyebilirim ama genede oyun çok zor bence suan için gereksiz ilerde noolur bilinmez
Better off burning your money than buying this.

column8:
Love the shipbuilding. The music, the good looking station and promise of a complex gameplay where your design will be tested. But when i launch my great spaceships, the early access game hits me in my face. Not much to do and i would really like to walk inside the ship and get a cocpit wiev, but understand that is a huge work and probably not achievable.

Still looks great, and when the universe and the gameplay gets as great as the building part in the wharf it will be a great game.

The game currently explains almost nothing about playing and playing it is pretty complex. It looks really fun and I really want to play, but currently I'd rather spend my time in a game instead of watching youtube videos and erading forums for hours just to figure it out.
When it gets some in game tutorials and more information I'll pick it up, but for now it'll sit on the virtual shelf.

column8:
Combat is virtually broke and exploration is virtually broken, rendering this barely anything but a ship building sim. And with the limited number of parts available a very poor sim indeed. 

This shows promise, but until their is massive improvement in the depth and bugs of the game I wouldn't recommend wasting your money.

Since when did buying re-release games become simply paying to be a tester?

column8:
The other day I got kinetic void because I've only heard good things about it and it was only five bucks. but so far it hasn't been worth it. I mean, the one main issue I have is the "tutorial". For some reason the menu that teaches you how to play is overlapping itself and covering up parts of important info so that you have to spend ten minutes figuring out how to just accelerate. Personally i suggest an optional standard space-ship style fps controls. Y'know, WASD and the mouse. Sure it was only five bucks, but I don't have that money to throw around. So game devs, I want to play your game but it just refuses to help me. It's like throwing a blind guy in front of a painting and saying "What color is that?" to him. I'd like some help or atleast my mony back. Right now, I don't want this game.


PROS: Great sandbox if you can figure it out, Open universe, Great developers, beautiful game

CONS: Clunky controls, Menus don't work, twenty dollars when it's not on sale

column8:
I LOVE the ship creator tool, it is pefect but the combat really lets it down. The first enemies you fly into can blow your ship that you took an hour to build, apart in 1/2 shots and you weapons bounce off them.

To the developer - please lower the difficulty at the beggining. It really makes you not want to carry on after your first couple of ships.

column8:
UPDATE 11th of December 2014:

So I gave it another try again. Hell how I regret it.

Once the galaxy initialization process was at 100% the screen started to flicker.
I waited. I waited longer. The game sent my Apple into limbo mode.
I had to hard reset the machine. Hopefully I did not lose any data.

BE CAUTIOUS!

This is the lousiest piece of software I encountered for months, not to say years.
I'm going to deinstall it. If there's a chance to wipe it off my library without erasing this review I'll do that, too. If I would be able to click two thumbs down, or even three, I would.



Here's my initial comment from August:

====

For now this feels like pre-alpha software. Fiddling around with the editor is no fun for various reasons. (*)
And the download took ages, too. If this would not be early access I'd now like to have my money back.

(*)

P.S.: I'm running the game in 1280x1024 on a low end Mac. There's an issue detecting clicks on at least all of the editor's top menu line icons: Even though you point at them your clicks don't get recognized properly, despite the icons getting highlighted. Instead there's only a small, let's say 4 pixel tall, detection area at lower icon end where clicks get recognized, even though the actual icons are much taller and clicking that low kinda feels like clicking off icon already.

http://steamcommunity.com/app/227160/discussions/11/35220315921355473/

column8:
This game is like X2 mixed with EVE but far less intuitive, if that is possible. Tutorial was worse than X, which is a bit more complicated, yet taught me how to play. This game has potential in the ship building process but adds little to no instruction on how to do so. The ship building could rise above other games but doesn't help you to design your first ship properly. The controls after my ship lauched resemble EVE with less instructon. I guess the sale on 5ish dollars represent its competiveness.

I am not happy with my purchase.

column8: (The rating is only for the current version its at itself) 8/10, This game is absolutely fantastic in my eyes, its got alot of bugs and parts wrong with it which is VERY understandable as its in Early Development, a few problems i ran into so far, some Game related the other ME related, firstly the mirroring system still needs abit of work, if you click and object to place and have not placed it just yet, you can turn the mirroring tool on and it works perfectly, but if you place (at the part where you can use the Arrows or loops to move/rotate) If you were to mirror once you've placed, it would go really weird, it wouldnt be mirrored at all, a problem that is most likely me related is, Every time i get in to this one galaxy that i've had created, I'm only in a corvette because after finishing up on that ship i came to realise you can make a BIGGER ship by clicking the number box above the construction menu *Derp* I keep getting swarmed upon spawn and as a noobie, even after figuring out the controls it gets abit hard to fight back which means i obviously either need a BIGGER ship, BETTER ship or just get better at the game haha xD but Oh my god, the Construction mechanics on this game, by far some of the best i've ever seen, i've been looking around for a damn long time for a game where you can have a HUGE Wide Free range of customization to your very own ship and the fact that I heard that hopefully this game would be getting multiplayer somewhile after the base game is complete, I was swooning, showing off your amazingly or Crazily made ships to your friends and facing off in battle just makes me drool! I have so much high hopes for this game and i've only managed to find out when it was on sale, i would of gladly payed the full price! (If and when i had the money xD) but this is a game for all Space Adventurers with a craving of customizing your very own ship to as much detail as the game can generate just for you, a Game i very much look forward to being completed by the development team! (as a wannabe Developer myself) I look up to you people, and i know almost everyone else does, so keep up the good work and to you people reading this, Take a chance, Buy this game and Hopefully you wont be disappointed!!!! Back up these Gorgeous Developers!!! <3

column8: Noch zu viele Abstürze und das Spiel an sich braucht noch etwas Inhalt. Auch die Grafik vom Raum selbst könnte etwas Tiefe vertragen. Aber das Raumschiffbauen macht echt Spaß. Für Early Access ists okay, wenn ichs doch nur etwas länger spielen könnt aber diese Abstürze... egal, lustig isses, daher empfehle ichs.
column9: There are still too many crashes, and the game itself needs some more content. The space graphics could also use some depth. But building spaceships is really fun. It's okay for Early Access, if only I could play it a little longer, but these crashes... whatever, it's fun, so I recommend it.

column8:
OMG yes this game is beautiful even on my laptop i have been really enjoying this game for the past couple of hours and i tell you what this is the kinda game i enjoy Building your own ships the way you want it built without magnets restricting you to on position you can have them rotate a full 360 up down left right and diagonal.

If you enjoy building the ships you want to build and explore a vast wide open galaxy buy this game you will not be dissapointed.
ive been looking at this game for a while and saw it was on sale for 5 bucks cause i didnt have the 20 and when i did i got something else on my list first kinda wish i got this first lol.

this is one of those game you can just build, remake, remaster and put what ever you want and name the ship what ever you want. I have seen people build giant Mechs out of the parts and thats freaking amazing with that kinda of stibuility that this game has i give it a 9 out of 10 because the game guide doesnt give you all the controls or that i have seen and second would be nice to have a dedicated surver to play with your friends and go up against them with your builds

column8:
Плюсы:
1) Конструирование кораблей из имеющихся модулей, произвольно.
2) Космос
Минусы:
1) Крайне "тугой" (читай неудобный) интерфейс.
2) Замудрённая и тяжёлая в освоении система постойки
3) Делать практически нечего.
Вывод:
Жду когда разработчики перестанут бухать и начнут делать игру. Брать только со скидкой не менее 85%
column9:
Pros:
1) Freely construct ships from existing modules.
2) Space
Cons:
1) Extremely clunky (read: inconvenient) interface.
2) Complex and difficult-to-master construction system.
3) Practically nothing to do.
Conclusion:
I'm waiting for the developers to stop drinking and start making a game. Only buy with at least an 85% discount.

column8:
挺有趣的沙盘游戏。前景广阔。又有EVE的各种，也能让人回想起自由枪骑兵。操作感有点一般。很多东西不完善。比如那空空的星球，也算无缝登陆星球了~自由造飞船，简直是帅的一比啊。在星球中间贸易，然后造一艘属于自己的飞船。很爽啊。总之非常有未来的游戏，但现在东西还是比较少。建造模式不太人性化。移动，以及镜像还是有些让人操作的很繁琐。我觉得弄成星球探险家那种编辑器就不错，或者是太空工程师那种编辑，也是很带感的。，希望以后有联机功能。

                                                                  以上作废

现在都喜欢卖个理念然后卷钱跑路吗？
column9:
It's a very interesting sandbox game with great potential. It has all the elements of EVE, and it's reminiscent of Free Lancer. The controls are a bit average. Many things are imperfect. For example, the empty planets are seamlessly accessible, and the free shipbuilding is incredibly cool. You can trade between planets and then build your own ship. It's very cool. Overall, it's a very promising game, but it's still quite limited. The building mode isn't very user-friendly. Moving and mirroring are still a bit fiddly. I think an editor like Planet Explorers or Space Engineers would be great, which would also be very exciting. I hope there will be online multiplayer functionality in the future.

The above is invalid.

Does everyone like to sell an idea and then run away with the money these days?

column8:
It is not working on my Mac!! It starts full screen and shows black screen. I can hear sounds but am not able to do anything about the graphics. I want my money Back!!! - Just kidding!!! :P

Finally got it working by editing the cfg file and running the app directly from the folder. It turns out that first time you run the game on Mac, it starts full screen and stays black with only audio. Please fix this issue. I can provide any more information if you like.

Secondly, if anyone can help me with how do I start a game? I click on New and select the attributes, name the galaxy, select Creation/Career mode and click on Start. Nothing happens and if I click again, it asks for Overwrite. Does anyone know about this? It might be a bug, or it might just be my lack of knowledge about the game. I am too lazy to search for it on the forums :P

Thanks in advance!

For now, as the game is not working any good for me, the recommendation is still NO!

column9: You can't really figure out the game, there's no Russian translation, everything is very complicated, you need to know English well to understand it, it took me half an hour to fly out into space, I flew out into space and there's nothing to do there, there aren't even NPCs, I won't even mention assembling ships, it's fucking difficult to figure it out, in general, I don't recommend it to those who don't understand English!

column8:
Frankly I don’t know where to start, this game is such a mess, the entire thing is awkward and amateurish, easily the worst early access title I have seen, even having bought it at -75% I feel cheated. I know folks want a more detailed review, than “it is crap”, but this junk is simply not worth any more of my time.

Simply put, since I started gaming in 1980, this is by far the worst piece of crap I have had the misfortune to stumble upon. My children and their friends produced better for their high school exams. 

That others can give this a thumbs up beggars belief, perhaps their parents are the ones trying to fob this shit off on the public.

column8:
This game is rather paltry on content at the moment, but has great potential. The devs are very friendly and are hard at work on it, though there are times when a month can pass by without any updates.
It is hard to get into, but just cruising around your galaxy with a ship you made is quite fun.
I'd give it a 7/10, wait and see.

If you are on the fence about getting it, just wait and see if becomes more than what it currently is. It is not bad, just very 'skeletal'.

EDIT: I realized the devs have not updated this game since January 2015, and even those were just small hotfixes. This game seems to be dead now, its developers abandoned it. Move along and find a different game.

column8:
First of all, this review covers the game in its current state (D14.2)
When I first started up the game all I got was audio na dno visuals...
After looking through forums I found this was common for Macs and has been happening for quite a while...
A major bug that should have been fixed ages ago. (the bug can be fixed by going into the display.cfg folder and changing the resolution to your monitor's native resolution and turning off AA)
When I first started to design my ship I noticed the graphics could be improved a bit...
But overall I enjoyed the ship creation part of the game!
After you leave the hanger and launch into space,  the game is rather borring...
A lot more could be added (I guess of course I haven't played this part of the game too much)

Overall the game sounds fun and is a great idea, but it has a lot to be added and I personally would wait until a later date to buy this game.

column8:
Claro ejemplo de video e imagenes del juego hechos expresamente sin ser tomados del juego, vamos...un engaño.
No es la versión final y mucho tiene que mejorar para dejar de ser un tocho en el vacio en el que se mueven los fondos planos.
Pocos controles y nada intutivos, escasa información en tiempo real y la sensación de no saber ni lo que hacer ni como hacerlo. 
Lo dejare aparcado unos meses a ver si los desarrolladores dejan de mirar porno y se ponen a trabajar.
column9:
A clear example of video and images from the game made specifically without being taken from the game, in other words... a hoax.
It's not the final version, and it needs a lot of improvement to stop being a mess in the void where the flat backgrounds move.
Few and unintuitive controls, little real-time information, and the feeling of not knowing what to do or how to do it.
I'll leave it on hold for a few months to see if the developers stop watching porn and get to work.

column8: This is not a game, it's just the husk of a game, the user interface is like user enemy, the dynamics are so 2001, the graphics are mediocre and control are awful. Even the design section is hard to get used to, go buy something else and do not do the same mistake we did.

column8:
A beautifully rendered, interesting sandbox/space fighter.
    + Has amazing graphics
    + Well optimized
    + Unique economical model
    + Option to switch between realistic (newtonian) and Kinetic Field flight (controls your velocity and direction precisely) modes
    - Notifies you of missions, auto-accepts them and thereby sends in bad guys to murderize you (as of D13, planned to change in the future)
    * Has built-in tutorial, but is not perticularly useful or userfriendly

Overall a good game, but still needs work; hence early access. If you are into space flight games and wish to build your own ships to shoot down your enemies, while looking absolutely beutiful at the same time, this is you're game.

EDIT: After letting it sit a while, most importantly after leaving early access, I feel like this game just does not live up to its potential. Unless the devs pick it up seriously again or give it to someone else, it will forever be a singleplayer sandbox of Elite:Dangerous with 60% of the features missing.
        I really want to love this game, but the lack of content (which would be ok with multiplayer) really kills it for me. If you are considering buying this game, don't. To the devs I ask only one thing, please, please, please finish this game as it deserves to be! You guys are letting a game with so much potential die and be ripped apart by a now-hostile community that is so ashamed by the fact this game was not finished.
        That being said I still like to just fly around in sandbox with a massive ship and blast everything out of everyone, but then I get bored and the economy is pointless in sandbox and quite frankly, with the limited information and lack of in-game tags of items to their economic counterparts, impenetrable and boring in career. I love the idea of a complex economic system, but there just isn't enough to do in it and the same with factions.
        Aside from missions, that rarely work, all you can do is not trade with a faction you don't like or blow up all their ships and not affect the trade of that faction as all ships (except yours) are military, with minimal cargo and minimal reward other than a tiny bit of rep from other factions, which does not give you lower prices or more hangar space (which is just taunting me in the station UI, waiting to be implemented along with the scaning system) or any other reward for that matter, making the only good way to get money reliably is to go mining, which takes a ridiculous period of time to mine one asteroid, which give maybe two good minerals at a time and dosn't sell for very much at all, maybe getting you enough to buy half of a hull segment on your already tiny mining ship, that must be built from the 'random parts' selection when creating the galaxy, as the Oberon Freighter has no mining laser (although it has a salvage, with not enough cargo space to hold any of the salvagable items) and the fighter (whose name escapes me) has barely enough firepower to get into a fight with a ship its own size, much less one of the ships that the AI controls with aimbot level skills (to be fair, your turrets have the same ability to aim with rediculous accuracy) and are almost all made of size three and up parts that dwarf your tiny starter ship.
        Basically, don't buy; devs, please finish this game. Great potential, but not enough to be considered complete. Sorry devs, I can't recomend this to anyone else although I would love to be able to. Please change my mind with a new update that can fix all the little things I have listed above, I know its hard to develop games, but please take another go; for your reputation's sake.

column8:
After shelving this game for sometime, I tried it again... aparently there has been massive amounts of work done on this game - just a shame I've not been able to see any of it...

After struggling through an overly complex ship design process, still no idea why I can only have 1 cargo module despite having plenty of room etc... you then get to launch your ship....

... to have it immediatly attacked outside the station - boom dead before even having a chance to manuver or even fire guns (or even work out how to target)

after this happened 4 times in a row - using different designs - I have to conclude this *might* be a game if only it were more understandable or at least had some kind of tutorial - other than an excuse of a tutorial which bassically looks like a VERY abridged manual....

One day after I've given the author further time to over complicate the game and I have about 60 hours free to read up on it and watch youtube I might even get some use out of this..... you never know....

column8:
Eh, I wouldn't recommend it. However I wouldn't tell anyone not to. I got it for free, right after Diaspora Shattered Armistice came out. I have checked up on the progress of the game and I am impressed! However I was thrown into an open world where I was overwhelmed and utterly confused. With the updates I could not find any way based off of previous knowledge of the game to actually create my own ship rather than be forced to have a preset one. 

Pros: 
1. Total Sandbox 
2. Never holds your hand 
Cons: 
1. Complicated 
2. Poor tutorial system

column8:
Worth getting just for the amazing ship yard system. It obviously isn't complete yet, and the lack of solid tutorials gives things a steeper than normal learning curve. But I have faith in this dev team to complete the task. They release updates frequently, and keep the community informed on their progress and plans. 

Seriously though... If you enjoy heavy customization the ship yard and construction system alone makes this game worthwhile. I do find myself hoping that the devs create a few more options in certain categories, but the possibilities are already staggering with 5 part scales and massive assortment of pieces.

column8:
When I bought this game, it seemed to potentially be a good game.  However after attempting to play it for 30 minutes, I've given up on it for the following reasons.

Default guidance of the ship seems to be the mouse, which when you have to use the mouse to utilize/close the windows that show up, can REALLY screw up where you're going.

It seems like that depending on your current situation, the default key for many different controls, USE THE SAME KEY BIND

zooming in/out.............why does it take several minutes of scrolling the mouse wheel to go from a close up of a single piece of your current ship to the point where you can now see.....*GASP* two pieces of the ship.

column8: At an hour in the Shipyard I was struggling. At 2 hours in I was going crazy. At 3 hours in the Shi[yard it all came together. Using tutorials and the in game guide I finally feel I have a firm grasp on the ship building aspect and built a ship I am happy with. At 6 hours I have explored the sector portion of the game. Mining is a hassel and drones are still needing some work. But damn I love watching 500 attack drones swarm an enemy ship destroying it like bees defending the hive. I am still unsure of how to take over sectors and what my faction is actually called. At 10 hours I stopped caring for who is friend and who is foe. I live the Pirate path now destroying anything with an hp bar. Drones still do not return to my ship and they simply dissapear... very frustrating when I wish to do a Mass Warp Drive(MWD). Many abbriviations in the hanger are confusing and I have given up on trying to debriviate them. At 15 hours I still cant figure out most of the game play and there are these updates that I am not really seeing on my game. Certain Screen shots of the Shipyard and what not, that are very refined and look way easier to navigate do not seem available. Also options for subsystems like the new crew option and what not are eluding me. I still love the game and the idea for its future. I cant wait to see how everything pans out because I forsee me playing this game for a significant amount of time.

column8: Great space sandbox game. The only complaint is that the controls take some serious getting used to and understanding how to build a ship is a little difficult. However, there are some great videos on youtube, so if you watch just half of one of those you should get a good enough of a grasp to be able to figure out the rest. So once you have the controls down its just a matter of your imagination seeing how all of the ships are cutom built with various modules that can be stacked or layered so the possibilites are rather endless. Also it has a Workshop so its going to be Mod friendly, and you can already post up your ships and download your favorites. So not only do you get to build your own ship, paint your own ship, and arm your own ship, you can then go fly and fight in your own ship. I see great things for this title.

column8: This is the final game that made me to decide to never buy an alpha version of anything again.  The updates are way too far apart and the changes in each are minimal.  While I find the concept very intriguing, it ends up being primarily a ship builder in my limited experience thus far.  I have floated into the spaceports, some allowing me to dock but then having nothing to actually do once I've done so and others showing the dock protocol but then not actually functioning.  I've flown around for what seems to be hours on end seeing only the 3 or 4 pirate ships that I believe are meant to be part of the tutorial and then nothingness forever.  Basically, I bought this on the idea, but I refuse to waste my money on these types of executions.

column8:
As of now, I cannot personally RECOMMEND that any consumer should buy this game for entertainment. Not in its current early access state. However! I can say that this game is currently moving on rails to success. After you read this review, please buy the game to show the developers some financial and informational support. Now to the actual game itself!

Graphical aesthetics are great and match with the atmosphere. The soundtracks are perfect for inducing that soothing yet unsettling feel of colossal space. planets, and that vibrant, atmosphereic scifi feel. [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O6rkm2v1N-g] Listen to it here.[/url] That is a reason that I was seduced into buying the game. As always, its the screenshots or cover of that book that you should not judge yet. As I segwayed further into the game, I was brought along a smooth road to introduction. The tutorial is a large ingame wiki, however I hope remake it into a more clever tutorial system. Well all hate tutorials that makes us feel like we are accomplishing nothing; I think virtually all of them are like that. It is hard not to do so. Skyrim did a good job with their tutorial. It was taught well as you were contributing to the story and felt a sense of accomplishment through it as you gt your first weapons, and always wanted to know who would live or die and what would happen next. I am getting off topic, perhaps I should give my adhd brain a break and finish the review later. . .

column8:
Not entirely a waste of money.





Pros: 
 ~ More intricate ship building: Less blocky designs, more artistic designs seem to be possible with this game.
 ~ More customization
 ~ Factions present, hostile and non-hostile.
 ~ Pretty good graphics, and runs very well. (Have not tested FPS with large ship builds yet, will do later.)
 ~ Vast space system.

Cons:
 ~ Guide and tutorial needs work. Bigger font size. Different color than the rest of the screen, make it big and bold etc, otherwise players are going to ignore it at first (like I did) and then kick themselves later for ignoring it. It took me 10 minutes to locate the information needed to simply apply Subsystems. If it takes that long for an average player to deduce that, interest will wane quickly.



Y'know, honestly... I was going to write a negative review...but while writing this piece I've had a chance to reflect upon the game itself. 

Right now it IS indeed worth the price. $20.00 USD for a Beta isn't too bad at all, especially given the wealth of content in game, not to mention the very awesome ship builder thing (once you get the hang of it).

For anyone thinking of buying this game.... be warned its not your garden variety Minecraft-esque Ship Building game. It takes some thought and a bit of patience to learn how to build a ship, how to make it fly etc etc. Its not easy, but it is rewarding once you've mastered how the game works.


Right now I'd give the game a 6/10. Its above average, but I'd like to come back and review it when its out of Early-Access / Beta etc.

column8:
Interesting in concept, lacking in content. 

This game has an atmosphere and flight experience that harkens back to the 90s and games like Star Quest I. This really isn't a good thing. On paper, the idea of a game where you can design, build and fly your space ships competely from the ground up the way you want them, is fantastic... but after spending a few hours messing around in the the game I couldn't even figure out what to do in the game, much less how to start building my own ship. The 'guide' was bare-bones at best and the interface was clunky and frustrating. 

As an early access game, some growing pains are expected, but this feels a lot less like a playable alpha and more like an unfinished engine with nothing to do in it. My recommendation is to skip this one for now and maybe check back later to see if things have improved before buying.

Interesting in concept, lacking in content. 

This game has an atmosphere and flight experience that harkens back to the 90s and games like Star Quest I. This really isn't a good thing. On paper, the idea of a game where you can design, build and fly your space ships competely from the ground up the way you want them, is fantastic... but after spending a few hours messing around in the the game I couldn't even figure out what to do in the game, much less how to start building my own ship. The 'guide' was bare-bones at best and the interface was clunky and frustrating. 

As an early access game, some growing pains are expected, but this feels a lot less like a playable alpha and more like an unfinished engine with nothing to do in it. My recommendation is to skip this one for now and maybe check back later to see if things have improved before buying.

column8: Most tragically non-intuitive game I have ever played.  It took me 30 minutes to figure out how to make my ship move forward, let alone figure out how to fight off enemy star fighters assaulting me from all angles in what I would expect to be relatively friendly space.  I have no idea how to earn additional money, I'm given the option to "cancel death" but can't manage to cancel death.  About the only thing I've successfully achieved is warping from one point to another.  This game shouldn't even qualify as early access... it's virtually unplayable.

so i was really interested in this game, then i started playing to find out it has horrible controlls, but you can remap most of it.

but UI is worst, they throw 4000 buttons at you and even with the tutorial(which is just a guide hidden somewhere in the game) its hard to actually do something. when after about 30 minutes i finnaly got myself a decent shit and flew outside it took me another 15 minutes to finnaly find the flight controls in the guide(which turns out is outdated).

when i finnally got a hang of flying i got a mission to kill some pirates, the game kept bugging me to kill them but they were no where to find.

it might become a good game eventually but now its not. glad i bought it on sale cause this would have been a waste of money if i bougt it for the full price

column9:
It's still pretty sparse. And in my opinion, the interface and gameplay are only getting worse. It looks very nice, but that's about it for now. Although, it depends. I wouldn't recommend it right now, and it's unclear when the game will evolve into something worthwhile (quests, tasks). The gameplay is rather empty (in terms of gameplay), the controls are awkward, and there's a lack of atmosphere (for example, in Freelancer, you actually went into a bar, not just saw a quest text). And the lack of graphical atmosphere isn't even compensated for by the text.

I've launched it many times, but I've never really played a single one.

Updated: The project has been abandoned, don't buy it.

column8: this game is very cool and has lots of potential. when i first got it i played it for a little bit and then a few weeks later i got bored of it completely. there is so little stuff in this game to do once you build your shit... it takes ages to get from point A to point B. the combat is ok..... if you can even get into a battle. there are so little enemies flying around and it takes forever to get to them or for them to come to you. and once you get to them they just fly off like your not there. i hope in the future they add more enemies or big fleets of ships for u to attack but thats it. its a good game if u just want to build a ship and float in space. for some reason, when ever i build a ship which takes about 30 mins and fly it in space the engines almost never work. and if they do the ship only goes 2miles per hour even when i make a fighter ship.this game has alot of potential but i cant recommend this until they make it a lot funner and add more stuff to it.

column8:
Великолепная байма. Просто слов нет, насколько она эпична... будет.

На данный момент в наличии есть только годный конструктор кораблей (Если вы могли проводить часы в редакторе кораблей из "galactic civilizations 2" и хоть чуть-чуть знакомы с 3D Studio Max или другими редакторами 3D моделей, то вам точно понравится) и бескрайний, молчаливый космос. 

Я наткнулся в обсуждениях на тему от такого же нуба, как я сам, который просил рассказать - что же в этой игре вообще можно делать. И там был довольно ёмкий ответ от самого разработчика. 

Я попробую сейчас кратенько пересказать его слова в формате FAQ:

Q: Какая разница между режимами игры "Creative" и "Career"?
A: Creative (творчество) - это режим, в котором у вас есть всё, чтобы сразу начать конструировать свой Дредноут Тёмного Властелина - при старте игры у вас уже имеется по 999 ВСЕХ деталей (корпус, пушки, подсистемы), которые на данный момент есть в игре. Более того - при каждой стыковке к любой станции количество всех деталей опять восстанавливается до трёх девяток. Твори - не хочу.
"Career" (карьера) в свою очередь представляет собой симулятор выживания в безмолвном и холодном космосе. У вас есть стартовый корабль - юркий истребитель, неуклюжий транспортник или "набор случайных модулей", 10000 кредитов, от 10 до 50 звёздных систем для исследования и от 2 до 12 фракций (пока они лишь воюют друг с другом). 

Q: Как тут зарабатывают деньги?
A: На данный момент есть два способа - добыча полезных ископаемых из астероидов и лутание сбитых кораблей. Для этого надо поставить на турель добывающий лазер (mining laser), а затем "атаковать" им астеройд (не забудьте впихнуть в ваш корабль побольше "cargo" подсистем - будет куда сложить породу!). Есть также более сложный способ - заниматься добычей с помощью специальных дронов - mining drones. Но для этого понадобится ангар, несколько подсистем, катапульта для дронов и (внезапно!) дрон-добытчик(и). В карьере это будет стоить определённых денег. Правда в стартовом корабле "Oberon freighter" уже есть дрон и всё необходимое для его использования. Но выбор компонентов не слишком оптимизирован, так что вам будет что улучшить.
Ну и продать намайненное, естественно,можно на космических станциях. Сначала нужно выгрузить породу из корабля на склад, а затем продавать в местном магазине. 
\от себя\ - когда количество руды стало стабильно переваливать за сотню, пришлось юзать автокликер, так как разрабы не прикрутили кнопки "продать всё из этой вкладки" х) 

Что-бы обобрать остов очередного космического неудачника, требуется свой, особый лазер.

Да и вообще любой корабль под управлением игрока очень быстро превращается в дикобраза, выставившего иглы разнообразных орудий во все стороны.

Над миссиями сейчас упорно трудятся и обещают выпустить их в ближайшем будущем.
UP Кое-какие простенькие миссии уже появились и выдаются рандомно, когда игрок болтается в космосе.

Q: Как путешествовать между Звёздными системами?
A: Есть два способа. Первый - Звёздные врата. На карте галактики они отмечены белыми линиями. Вам нужно прилететь в ту точку, в которой эта линия начинается\заканчивается в вашей системе (как правило это станция) и отправиться на другой конец врат - на другую станцию, в другой системе.
Второй способ, как обычно, более нетривиален - понадобится подсистема "Jump Drive". 

Вот так, если вкратце. Оригинал (уже несколько устарел) - http://steamcommunity.com/app/227160/discussions/0/540744475485931024/

Так же есть гайд на Немецком и Английском языках "первые шаги" - http://steamcommunity.com//sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=271950254

Звуки и музыка приятные. В ранних версиях звук "убивался" по непонятной причине, но в сборке D14 эту проблему починили.

В целом потенциал у этой баймы очень высокий. Разрабы обещают запилить кооп, обучение и прочие ништяки.

Оставайтесь с нами (с)
21.06.2014 

Last change: 28.09.2014
column9:
What a magnificent story. Words simply cannot describe how epic it will be.

Currently, all we have is a decent ship designer (if you could spend hours in the ship editor from "Galactic Civilizations 2" and are even slightly familiar with 3D Studio Max or other 3D model editors, you'll definitely love it) and the vast, silent expanse of space.

I came across a thread in the discussions from a fellow noob like me, asking for clarification on what you can actually do in this game. And there was a pretty succinct answer from the developer himself.

I'll try to summarize his words in FAQ format:

Q: What's the difference between the "Creative" and "Career" game modes?
A: Creative is a mode where you have everything you need to start building your Dark Lord's Dreadnought right away. When you start the game, you already have 999 of ALL the parts (hull, guns, subsystems) currently in the game. Furthermore, each time you dock at any station, the number of all parts is restored to three nines. Create as much as you want.
"Career," on the other hand, is a survival simulator in the silent, cold reaches of space. You have a starter ship—a nimble fighter, a clumsy transport, or a "set of random modules"—10,000 credits, 10 to 50 star systems to explore, and 2 to 12 factions (for now, they're just fighting each other).

Q: How do they make money here?
A: Currently, there are two ways: mining asteroids and looting downed ships. To do this, you need to equip a mining laser on a turret and then "attack" an asteroid with it (don't forget to pack your ship with plenty of "cargo" subsystems—you'll have plenty of room to store the minerals!). There's also a more complex method: mining with specialized drones. However, this requires a hangar, several subsystems, a drone catapult, and (surprise!) a mining drone(s). This will cost money in the quarry. The starting ship, the "Oberon Freighter," already includes a drone and everything needed to use it. However, the component selection isn't very optimized, so you'll have room for improvement.
And, of course, you can sell your mined minerals at space stations. First, you need to unload the minerals from your ship into a warehouse, and then sell them at the local store.
\on my own\ - when the ore count began to consistently exceed a hundred, I had to use an autoclicker, since the developers didn't implement a "sell everything from this tab" button x)

To loot the wreck of yet another space loser, you need your own special laser.

And in general, any ship under the player's control very quickly turns into a porcupine, with its quills of various weapons pointed in all directions.

They're currently working hard on missions and promise to release them in the near future.
UP: Some simple missions have already appeared and are randomly generated when the player is out in space.

Q: How do I travel between star systems?
A: There are two ways. The first is through Stargates. They're marked with white lines on the galaxy map. You need to fly to the point where this line begins/ends in your system (usually a station) and travel to the other end of the gate—to another station, in another system.
The second method, as usual, is more complex—you'll need the "Jump Drive" subsystem.

That's it, in a nutshell. Original (already somewhat outdated) - http://steamcommunity.com/app/227160/discussions/0/540744475485931024/

There's also a "First Steps" guide in German and English - http://steamcommunity.com//sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=271950254

The sounds and music are pleasant. In earlier versions, the sound was "killed" for some unknown reason, but this issue was fixed in build D14.

Overall, this game has a lot of potential. The developers promise to add co-op, training, and other goodies.

Stay tuned (c)
June 21, 2014

Last updated: September 28, 2014

column8:
A freaking waste of 10 dollars.
I may be an old time gamer, but I'm not THAT old. 
The controls are atrocious beyond belief. Controlling the ship is slow and cumbersome, controlling weapons is beyond unintuitive towards the outright moronic. I played nearly every space combat game known to man on the PC since Privateer. Even Eve online gives a better 'dogfight' feel than this game. 

The ship customization is pretty nice, I'll give it that, but that doesnt even come close to compensating the hideous combat. Locking, adding to target group, FIRE! I said FIRE!!!! Fire? Please FIRE already? Pretty please? Boom, I'm dead. Where is the dog fight? Where are the tactics? Where the hell is the weapons fire?

column8:
Update: This review is rather for an older state of the game. It might not reflect current mechanics and working/not working gameplay.
----

As of yet the game is unplayable. It is an very early development built. I would even go that far to say that it still is a concept build. A proof of concept. There are some good ideas like building your own ship but the implementation is nearly unusable. I miss distinctions between the modules. If I compare the screenshots to the actual game I didn't get that far because you are simply left alone in the (kinetic) void of the absence of guidance. 
There is this rule in game development:
90% of the games started being developed will never finish. This is one perfect candidate for this rule. 

Before this "Early Access" hype, development of such failed projects where never to be compensated. Today with Early Access you can make $$ despite you will never finish your game.

column8: I cannot recommend this game. They broke it. It used to be great - a sandbox experience where you could create any ship you wished, drag the file around in the directories, set up custom factions, create an entire universe with it's own factions, each with it's own style of ship (designed by you) and it's own alleigances / hostilities. Yeah. Not anymore. Now it's a dull, repetative, REALLY slow space game where by you need to mine ore, salvage ships and trade in a dull flying sim to make credits and upgrade your ship. Creating custom faction folders just causes a game crash now. The ship builder has a bunch of dumb restrictions that seriously limits the game's potential. Save your money. Man I wish I could go back to an older version.

column8: Note that I barely have gameplay into the game. I originally got the game and spent hours building a ship, definitely going to be a simulation, you have to have housing for crew, where to eat, medic bay, cargo etc. If you build a ship wrong it will float im space with no acceleration or not be able to turn very much. When I first got the game it was an unlimited build, do whatever you want and it was pretty cool to build a monster ship to tear through space. However, last time I tried to play there was an update that gave you a credit limit so small you literally could not build a reasonably operable ship; Leaving out key parts such as the mess hall, medic bay and cargo etc. my updated ship still topped out at about 20 MPH and took literally about a minute and some to turn a 360 (buying only the cheapest parts necessary to fly and still ran out of credits). This has a lot of potential but hopefully that update was fixed. Or there was some feature option added I did not notice.

column8:
Delivers on all the very worst tedium of a 4X game with almost none of the freedom or wonder.  The generated universes are very featureless and bland.  The combat is a snorefest.  A sad skeleton of a game built backwards from the ceiling down.  There's a neat ship creation system but with nothing compelling for you to do with the ships you create, it's utterly pointless.

The only entertainment I can find anyone having with the game thus far is creating ships with the generator and then posting them on the workshop.  Consider the game LEGO with spaceship parts, then.

I'm sure this review will get thumbs-downed like nuts from a bunch of apologists who would recommend the game to you on the basis of what it could be and not what it actually is.  Anyone who would recommend this game to their friends based on its current state is a poor friend to have.

column8: Mostly just a creative shipyard (very well done) with a terrible flight mechanic and star-trading aspect attached to it.  Granted, this is only Early Access, I would like to see it get better.  However, it is shaping up to be a game that not too many star trading fans would like.  Go purchase Starpoint Gemini 2 or one of the other star traders out there.  If you're uncreative and just want this for the space aspect, don't bother.

column8:
Vorweg muss man sagen, dass es sich bei "Kinetic Void" um ein Spiel im Alpha Stadium handelt.
Daher versuche ich nicht zu sehr auf Bugs und ähnliches einzugehen, sondern eher auf die Features selbst, die das Spiel bietet.

Wie oben gesagt ist das Spiel noch in der Alpha, daher werde ich nur kurz auf den Bau-Modus eingehen, den "Dogfight" (Kämpfen im Weltraum).

Ersteres ist nach lernen der Shortscuts sehr amüsant da bisher eine relativ große Anzahl an diversen Teilen zur Verfügung steht - für Alphastatus verkraftbar, allerdings für später noch etwas zu wenig, aber die Developer haben an dieser Stelle noch Zeit nachzubessern.
Der Dogfight ist derzeit noch etwas roh, und das merkt man an einigen Stellen - so habe ich es bisher noch nicht geschafft, mein Schiff auf "Autofeuer" einzustellen, sondern ziele mit der Hand - was im Vergleich zu der KI die Autofeuer besitzt und quasi immer trifft ein kleiner Nachteil ist.

Grundlegend ein sehr interessantes Konzept, besonders auch durch die Customization die man an seinem Schiff vornehmen kann, und die vollkommen offene Welt durch die man quasi Minecraft in Space hat.
Für den bisherigen Alphastatus kann ich das Spiel nur weiterempfehlen - unter anderem deswegen, weil es monatliche Updates gibt (in meinen Augen ein Kritikpunkt bei vielen anderen Spielen!), und immer wieder "Hotfixes" um nach und nach Bugs zu beseitigen.
column9:
First of all, it should be noted that "Kinetic Void" is a game in alpha.
Therefore, I'll try not to dwell too much on bugs and the like, but rather on the features the game offers.

As mentioned above, the game is still in alpha, so I'll only briefly discuss the build mode, "Dogfight" (combat in space).

The former is very entertaining after learning the shortcuts, as a relatively large number of various parts are available so far – manageable for alpha status, but still a bit too few for later, but the developers still have time to improve this.
The dogfight is currently a bit rough, and you can notice this in some places – for example, I haven't been able to set my ship to "autofire" yet, so I aim with my hand – which is a slight disadvantage compared to the AI, which has autofire and almost always hits.

Fundamentally, it's a very interesting concept, especially with the customization you can do with your ship and the completely open world, which is essentially Minecraft in space.
I can only recommend the game for its current alpha status – among other things because there are monthly updates (in my opinion, a criticism of many other games!) and constant "hotfixes" to gradually eliminate bugs.

column8: Currently empty without much to do, terrible UI and some awkward controls. This game is also seemingly rarely updated to any meaningful level and the changes are very slow. Space Engineers would be a far better investment of your money, more rewarding ship building, physics and ship damage and more importantly much faster game updates with surprisingly good features being added reguarly. This one might be worth it upon completion but something tells me that will be a long way off and even then there will probably be better alternatives unfortunately.

column8:
This game has a great deal of potential, especially for those who enjoy being creative.  Though I haven't played it very much, the potential for expandability, custom missions, and the like is very impressive.  I truly look forward to seeing how this game evolves.

Update: Despite this game's potential, it failed to live up to that potential when it was released far too early.  Between the lack of features, bugs, and failure to perform to its potential, I cannot recommend this game to others.

column8:
Being a somewhat old school Eve/X3/spacejesus gamer, I was really interested in trying KV when I heard a few details in passing, Of course, I have the memory of a gnat, and forgot about it for a couple of weeks, I just bought and downloaded it now,.

You start out with a deceptivly simple looking ship; cockpit, engines, guns and superstructure, however all these parts are modular, so you can move stuff around, have it at a different angle and so on, to personalise your ship as much as you like.

I'm really happy to have got this now, as the developers have some great Ideas, and are planning to develop this game for a while after release, So, I can see myself puttering around in the galaxy for a long time to come.

column8:
Kinetic Void is a very Early Alpha game. A few annoying bugs and glitches which hopefully get fixed sooner rather than later. The ship building is amazing. despite the bug and glitches. It is fantastic. Easily the best part of the game with me. Space flight is not too bad. I think as and when future updates come out then it will improve. Right now you just fly around shooting stuff, mining asteroids, selling the ores and building bigger better ships. Would like to see the planned economy come out. That should improve the gameplay a lot, Would also like to see the ability to start a factions, take space stations, mining stations, claim systems, Have NPC ships fly around the galaxy mining, and defending territory.

Performance of the game is very good. On High end hardware the game runs over 110 FPS on maxmimum settings.  Graphics are very good in most places. In some places like the engine trails, they are pretty poor, at least to myself.

Should you buy this game? In my opinion yes. While right now there are bugs and glitches, which is to be expected in an early alpha game, The future looks bright, with the developers looking well into the future with possible multiplayer and DLC content.

column8:
The main problem I have with the game is an utter lack of direction.  Specifically how to move.  It took me longer then it should have to figure out that the space bar is your acceleration.

Next problem is the lack of a tutorial when it comes to ship making.  The way it is currently set up is simply "Heres your hanger, have fun".  What would help would be a tutorial option with ship making.

Another tutorial that would help would be one dealing with space combat.  Enimies can snipe me from almost 30 Km away where as I can not see them at all.  That was after I figured out that Z actives your guns, but I still don't know what the other indicators on the center dial are.


Okay, how to improve.  First a tutorail on some basic controls (movement, weapon selection, and the like), building your ship and space combat.  Until these are ironed out I can not recomend this game.

column8:
When I first launched Kinetic Void, I was met with something that had a smell of bad UI... It turned out I was right! It was pretty obvious that I had to create a new galaxy to satrt playing, and then I just selected the starter ship. When it came to adding additional parts to the ship, it was VERY, and I repeat VERY confusing. The controls and ship building is horrible! I have a feeling I would have a better time playing Guise of the Wolf. When i looked at the game guide to find the controls, they didn't bloody work!
It has an intresting concept that could have made a great game, but with what I'm seeing now... That's probably never goind to happen.
BTW: I got a headache playing this game, not because it was making me dizzy, but because I was so confused!

column8: Please read before buying. This game is NO WHERE NEAR done. Early access here means early alpha. The builder is buggy to say the least, with alot of features missing and the once that are avalible are unoptimized. The flight in it self is .... horribly borring... I LOVE openworld spacegames, and that is what this is - except there is NOTHING to do other than fighting completely easyfrag opponents, OR suiciding vs. a much stronger fleet of ships. There are some early stages of "missions" here, which randomly pops up... They are mostly "please same me" - and they are totally uninspired. It might become something when it's done, but right now, get something else.

column8:
Well im not going to lie, this game is quite difficult. There is no tutorial on how to do anything, there is a keybinding page but that only helps so much. my first combat encounter involved me trying to figure out well how do i shoot the person, and then they rammed me and i exploded.

Second time around i figured out how to get a targeting reticle to manually fire but thats pretty much useless .

Lastly and i hope they fix this, is your ship feels like its at the end of a stick with how the camera feels. Im sure many of my complaints would be resolved with a joystick but the lack of any kind of tutorial makes it very difficult to do anything

column8:
Changed review to NOT RECOMMENDED.
Appears the development has been abandoned.


(Original positive review) Great. Steam Workshop already, and a developer who joins in with the community. This game is going to be superb.
They are concentrating on all the right things first. Procedurally generated universes which you can save and come back to, user made ships, plenty of videos and tutorials to get you started.  There is more to this one than meets the eye. With this solid foundation the rest of the content will fall intro place.
If they are not careful they'll give Early-Access a good name ;)

column8: I bought KV because I wanted exactly as it was described:  “Kinetic Void is a 3D space adventure with a focus on customization and enjoyable space simulation.”  And it was, it was a lot of fun.  Open ended design-build of ships of any size, kind, and configuration.  The graphics were beautiful, you could seek out battles or just cruise through the stars.  At times it was like a living, ethereal journey through space with nice music (and if you shut off the HUD it was like a living screen saver).  It was wonderful.  I took full advantage of the developer's description that “our in game ship builder allows players to construct their ship piece by piece.  Ships can be as simplistic as a cockpit, a single hull, a single engine and a single gun, or as complex as a player wants” and that ships can be “creative (unlimited components)” and I did build these.  Small fighters to huge Dreadnaught size.  But now, with recent mandatory patches, this has all been for nothing.  The advertised “open world sandbox” KV is purported to be is now becoming a concrete, high requirement game just like all the others out there.  All the ships I spent much time building I can no longer launch, and I'm not spending three months rebuilding a single huge ship because of the new “disconnected  components” requirement the developers have instilled (despite their allowing a freeform creation of ships) that came through force-fed updates even when I was opted out of this.  Even upon re-install the changes were there.  This game, in fact, used to be “customizable and enjoyable” but because of the forced changes now it has simply become a chore to play.  This game has gone from my “highly recommend” list to my “highly avoid” list, and the game's description now needs to be changed because it's no longer what it was.  The only questions left is for me to ask steam how to delete it from my games list.
