column8:
This game shows great potential, who knows, it could become something great, the building mechanics are brilliant and the detail is real nice.
but the D12 update made me lose some faith in this game, they completely messed it up, infact i will go to say they F@$!ed it up, hard, i have never seen such a mess up, the building menu is almost imposible to navigate, one bad move and you have to restart your entire ship, bug bugs and oh look, more BUGS, and heven forbid, i do not want to see anything passed the building menu. but not the entire update is a mess up, they now have paint styles and even if the menu for ship building is so far gone and messed up, it has this professional look to it and just screams Si:Fi, and the creativity is real good, i can spend hours on it and the part where you finaly fly your ship out of dock and test it, makes you feel like a boss, cause normal, if you are on creative, it owns (a good suggestion when its your first time, play on creative) and having hardpoints that are animmated, and watching them activate, makes me want to just imagin one day having multiplayer and jumping and and being the capital ship of a huge fleet in the middle of a war.
even IF they messed up D12 and i losed some faith in this game, it could most likely recover, i just hope they recover before people lose hope for this game entirely,
this game is great and i am willing to forgive the game and the devs for the D12 update, (only if they dont mess D13 up like they did with D12) but for a suggestion, wait a little while, or get this when its on sale, dont get it at full price right now, cause this game is sitting on the edge of a deep hole, and if the devs dont get it together and work on the menu, then this game could lose its fans, but
anyway i give the game, 6.48/10 steam stamps (thats my rating system: steam stamps)

Edit:
Now, i would like to say, that, dear Devs, you made D13 one of the best updates.
Building Is WAY more responsive plus, with all the new tools that i just found, they allow you to do New things, like the one tool (i forgot its name) allows the player to move one part into another, Allowing for some rather good Ships, myself included. so, i have gained all my hope back thanks to the devs fixing the things that where wrong in D12, and overhauling the entire game with D13, so, if you are reading this, and you have not bought the game, then i would call you crazy to click off the page and not buy it, but before you do buy it (unless you want to show your support) wait till muiltplayer come out.
i re-rate this game 8.8/10 steam stamps (like i said before, i rating system)
(additional: if you want me to rate a game, PM me)


Edit #2 (Final)
This game has gone to a whole new level of epic with D14.2 just because of the fact that now i can basicly hover right over a planet, go as about 30 meters from the ground without being blowen up, but there are somethings that could be impermented to make this game better, first off, landing gears, to land on a planet, second, just maybe, add someway of exploring a planet, with a vehicle or running around on the planets. there are alot of things that could be added, but those twos where the first things that came to mind.
(if you want the review, read that part the other parts just not this edit)

(additional: if you want me to rate a game, PM me)


Edit #2 (Final)
This game has gone to a whole new level of epic with D14.2 just because of the fact that now i can basicly hover right over a planet, go as about 30 meters from the ground without being blowen up, but there are somethings that could be impermented to make this game better, first off, landing gears, to land on a planet, second, just maybe, add someway of exploring a planet, with a vehicle or running around on the planets. there are alot of things that could be added, but those twos where the first things that came to mind.

column8: As most reviews have said up to now, KV is in Early Access, and thus has a long way to go. That being said, the fact that it does have a ways to go is less of a reminder than something to look forward to(as is often the case in Early Access games) as this game is remarkably whole. You generate a universe, build a ship(or if that's not your thing there are plenty of perfectly fine pre-built ships), and launch it into space. You fly around vaporizing enemies(or getting vaporized...you'll learn your limitations very quickly) and completing missions, and, if your hull is about to crumble or you decide you can do better with the design, you return to the ship yard and make adjustments. As it stands, the missions do need work, as they are random and can become repetitive, and the help center and be opaque to people starting out, but for those looking for a space sim because of exactly what it is: a sim, this game is excellent.

column8:
NOTE: this only covers what the game is in its current state, as more content is added I may (read probably) change to recommending this game.

The premisce of this game is gorious, build a beautiful spaceship from parts, stick modules in and fly around in a proceduraly generated universe. However at the moment there isn't enough content in the game to justify the purchase. While there are plenty of parts and they look lovely, adding modules is very tedious, and most of them don't even do anything yet. The combat currently fells quite lacking, fly towards an enemy, lock onto them and push a button to turn on your guns. Now keep your ship so the guns can turn to face them and try to stay in range.

Then there are the performance issues. The performance of the game isn't great, about as good as you could expect from an alpha. Both content and performance wise the game is improving, but I personally will require more real gameplay to be added before I am prepared to recoomend this game.

column8:
EDIT: Just wanted to come back 6 years later and say that the game is dead with no further development continuing. It had a lot of potential but that potential died years ago.

Ah, Kinetic Void. What can I say about this beauty? For starters, the ship building is easy to use an monumentally powerful. While I have encountered some games that give you about 20 pieces and 20 spots to put them, Kinetic Void's ship builder truly lets you build whatever you want. If you don't like using the node system to place pieces, there is a freehand mode that lets you put anything anywhere. There are tons of pieces and all are resizable. On the largest setting, the pieces are insanely massive, and the more creative will find many pieces to build full size replicas of some of sci-fi's most famous ships. But this game isn't just space ship builder simulator. It has an incredibly well made space exploration portion. The ships to show their size quite well, as maneuvering a giant capital ship take much longer than a small agile fighter. There are tons of weapons of different damages and types and there are also preset ships for new players to use. In conclusion, Kinetic Void is an absolute masterpiece and I cannot reccomend it more.

column8:
Long, long way to go on this one. The premise is good and one day it may be realised...but not yet. One thing the developer oes do is listen to the community and continually works on the program. Unfortuantely, it should have stayed in the hangar another 6 months at least.

EDIT (July) - With the upcoming July patch the game looks to becoming a game. Up until now there has been nothing enjoyable about KV, my opinion oly, but with this patch the sim/game might finally be closer to a completely playable package than previously. Looking forward to what comes next and as such have rated the game a "tumbs up" at this point.

EDIT (March 2015) - A concept with much promise in the beginning yet left to fail and die as a "game". The 'Build' element was tragic and problematic from the beginning, but all there was to the title. Now, even it has been nerfed. This is NOT a "game" but a broken concept. Beware!

Edit: Read Comments O.o

First off i would like to say that this is almost a cut and paste from another review I have done.  If your reading this review, you already know if the game will be anything close to what your looking to play.  I am here to review the Devs of the game.  So many teams out there pump whatever dribble they please out without consideration of those playing the game.  Ive owned the game for a long time and when I got the game it was very incomplete.  As of todays patch I will be loading it up again to see the progress.  The newest patch made me reread some of the discussions and reviews, just to see the team be concerned over positive and negative reviews as they are, and the way they phrase the responses has led me to admire and respect them.  And I know my experience and concerns about the product will be addressed with the same level of care.  Dont take that for granted people, if your just looking into the game be assured your opinion counts and just buy it already, support good devs and help shape the things to come.

column8:
It is rare i write one of these, my time and words are not flung around lightly. This game is incredible fun even in its current state and i can only imagine what the future will hold. Currently it feels like a combination of Starmade and Eve. Starmade in how you build and manage your ships and Eve in how combat flows (But without insanely long buld times and skill trees ((yet???)) ). You can buid everything from tiny fighters to dreadnaughts the size of planets and beyond. Build you ship for looks or to focus your firepower tacticaly and as for guns....the new system gives you LOTS of options. The game has had it's bumps in the form of glitches but the creators actually listen to the community and talk with us to try to figure out whats going on so they can fix it. If i can hope for one thing to come it would be the ability to fly with friends.

Update: The game now feels alive, so many ships flying about and reports coming in all the time keeping you up to date makes the game quite exciting now. All i can hope now flying about in space is that the developers really consider adding the ability of multiplayer. Flying about with friends or opening up a public server for massive clashes between player groups would be amazing. I can honestly see if this game gets multiplayer it becoming a cheaper and far easier alternative to EVE for people like me who refuse to pay monthly fees.

column8: #ERROR!

It was as if EVE Online and Kerbal Space Program had a baby, and that baby was a total badass. Build your ship to be whatever you desire and explore, fight, and be an interstellar accountant(I know that that may not sound fun, but it worked out great for EVE.) inside a beautiful universe which for some reason has awesome music playing in the backround. NPCs will call for your help, maybe ambushing you with three or four enemy ships. The reqirement specs are quite low, I know because I have a 720p 2009 iMac, and the framerate is pretty smooth at max settings. If you listen to the devs, then you can tell that they really care about Kinetic Void. This game has tons of potential, and I think that it's going to deliver. And if you don't like the game, then GLaDOS will give you cake!

column8:
Okay, so maybe it's just me being bad at games, but I can't seem to play this game still. I believe that you have to kill enemies to get more money so you can buy more ship parts to make you stronger or get supplies to mine. I'm stuck at the first step. I can't seem to come even close to defeating an enemy ship (usually they come in groups of two or three, so it's essentially impossible). I fire everything that I have, hit the ship so many times, but there health barely drops...and then regenerates. Mine, on the other hand get destroyed very easily.

So, I gave up on trying to fight for a while and decided to go exploring...that didn't work out either. I spent like five minutes using warp drive (or whatever the Kinetic Void version is), just to get out of that same starting area. I thought this was going to be easy, but apparently not. All that got me was five minutes away from everything. The only thing on my radar was that starting station. I also can't figure out the map.

Chances are, I'm missing something really obvious, but I watched their videos on combat and did everything that they did, but I still fail every fight with the enemy. An in-game tutorial is a must-have for games like this.

Once this game is complete, I would love to see it as a rival for the games in the X series, but it has a looooooooooooooong way to go.

column8: Dans sa forme actuel, ce jeux n'interessera que les amoureux de l'espace et des "Lego". J'ai personelement passé beaucoup de temps à fabriquer de petits vaisseaux et ce avec grand plaisir.
column9: In its current form, this game will only be of interest to space and Lego lovers. I personally spent a lot of time building small spaceships and enjoyed it very much.

column8:
Malgré son état ambryonnaire, c'est un jeu au potentiel immense. Une future référence dans le genre.

J'ai surtout exploré la portion "Shipyard" qui est l'editeur de vaisseaux et c'est très intéressant. Les amateurs de création/modification seront ravis. Cet aspect est actuellement (et demeurera probablement) le point fort du jeu.

Le côté "exploration et combat" est toutefois moins captivant et c'est bien compréhensible. Son développement est minimal et ne permet que de tester les vaisseaux qu'on a créer, dans des situations de combat sans scénario.
column9:
Despite its infancy, this is a game with immense potential. A future benchmark in the genre.

I mainly explored the "Shipyard" section, which is the ship editor, and it's very interesting. Fans of creation/modification will be delighted. This aspect is currently (and will probably remain) the game's strong point.

The "exploration and combat" aspect, however, is less captivating, and that's understandable. Its development is minimal and only allows you to test the ships you've created in combat situations without a story.

column9: scam

column8: Kinetic Void is a game that allows you to build your own spacecraft from scratch. Very few games do that and less run this smooth. I use a some-what slow and old computer, but KV still runs. With the help of the steam workshop and community, you can upload your ships and load someone else's. You can also make several ships in one world and each world is randomly generated. I've played my fair share of EVE: Online and the knowledge of ships has only improved by playing this game. I look forward to tech trees and other advancements in the campaign.

column8:
So, I came into the store one day, and while I was looking through the gaming archives for a new passtime, this popped up. I looked at the reviews, they didn't turn out too bad, so I took an immediate interest due to the pictures and effective wording done by the game developers of how it works, and also because of its' high praise by other players. So I bought, and downloaded it.

After starting the game, a series of menus (the game played without much lag at all, it seems to be very effectively coded) that brought me to the ship creation menu. The whole thing was obviously still in development, as is the whole game, so I wasn't fazed. So far, it seems to have a solid menu system, and I love and hope that they try to make a little more sense of the icons, numbers, subsystems and such, because it wasn't all clear as to what they did, or meant, or how they affected the ship.

So, after a few minutes of confused silence, I decided to choose one of the pre-made ships, and set off on my journey through space.

I had fun. The distances were ridiculous, and the slip-space mechanic was a bit underdeveloped, but hey, it's a still-in-progress. What do you expect?

Then I went into the fighting mode, in which I was destroyed in seconds, and had a good laugh at how horrible I was at simulators, and confused as to how exactly the weapons functioned. Once they did fire at the enemies, however, their power was surprisingly underwhelming.

I see a lot of promise in this recently-aquired game, though I've barely tapped into its' evidently deep wells of entertainment. I do reccomend this game as it will continue to develop, and the onward march of progress is a brilliant thing to behold.

column8:
Купил ее сегодня, немного поиграл. Расскажу вкратсе, это- этакая пародия на KSP (Kerbal Space Program), но тут нету физики, вообще, вы можете сделать корабль вообще не пропорциональным, и он полетит. Но я большой фан игр такого типа. Много разных  вариантов как посстроить твой корабль. Если вы играли в KSP то вам не надо даже будет обьяснять как игра работает. Но в целом идея мне очень нравиться. Со скидкой в 50% можно взять. Но если будут денбги, то я бы больше советовал взять Space Engeneers, игра похожая но в целом она лучше. Тут уже на ваше усмотрение брять или нет
Плюсы
+ Хорошая вариация деталей
+ Не плохая графика
+ Корабли хорошо прорисованы
+ Вы можете выбирать между разными тактическими вариантами, для каждой детали корабля
Минусы
- Нету Физики
- На рынке уже есть игры такого плана
- Похоже на копию KSP

ВСЁ 
Спасибо за внимание!
column9:
I bought it today and played a little. I'll give you a quick overview: it's a parody of KSP (Kerbal Space Program), but there are no physics. You can make your ship completely disproportionate and it will fly. But I'm a big fan of these types of games. There are so many different ways to build your ship. If you've played KSP, you don't even need an explanation of how the game works. But overall, I really like the idea. You can get it with a 50% discount. But if you have money, I'd recommend Space Engineers; it's a similar game, but overall better. It's up to you whether to shave or not.
Pros
+ Good variety of parts
+ Decent graphics
+ Ships are well-drawn
+ You can choose between different tactical options for each ship part
Cons
- No physics
- There are already games of this type on the market
- ​​Looks like a copy of KSP

THAT'S IT
Thank you for your attention!

column8: as an early release ship building is the only fun to be had here...sure you can take your creations out for a spin, sure you can attack other ships (A.I.) but the combat is boring and sometimes drawn out depending on whether you have created a leviathan or a light fighter..flight appears static unless you pass a station or another vessel, only warp gives you a sense of speed....missions are non existent so dont purchase if you are expecting some....great potential here, lets just see where the devs take it.

column8:
Well you can't get any more sandbox than generated galaxies, ships built module-by-module and a variety of factions that differ from galaxy to galaxy. Kinetic Void has the potential to be a great game.

It is still in development, however, and is lacking some important features. Right now, I'd still rather play X3... or even X Rebirth. But that is not to say that game has no future. How will it compare with Star Citizen? Well I think it might be able to top the single-player sandbox experience (given Star Citizen will be an instanced MMO), but the game feels a little arcady at present, and don't get me started on joystick support.

I'd recomment this game merely for trying out the ship building and galaxy generation features, but I wouldn't call its gameplay enticing just yet. Give it a few.

column8:
Kinetic void currently is in Early Access stage, but already shaping up pretty well.
Its a freelancer like sandbox game, where you able to build your own ship from different parts, attaching weapons to what ever piece you want, and filling your ship with different internal systems like: shields, reactors, armor, sensors and so on...
Ship sizes can range from tiny fighters to a titan like dreadnoughts.
The game have beautiful visuals, and as i already noticed, they tend to revisit some of the assets end improve them even more.
Kinetic Void getting constant updates, and each getting it closer to completion.
Developers are active in discussions and watching for good ideas and suggestions to shape the game.
Considering this game is in Early Access stage, you might think that its better to wait a bit and probably will be right, but you definitely should check again later for a potential buy.

For more information on the current state of the game you can watch this thread:
http://steamcommunity.com/app/227160/discussions/0/828934089568066176/

column8: This game is simply a Masterpiece. Truly giving the player the feeling that they're in a massive, open, and dangerous galaxy (which the player can make to an extent). Allowing players to make vesels of any shape and size; players can make speedy cargo ships to extremely large and powerful ships bent on destroying their enemies. Never the less adventure always awaits you in "Kinetic Void", and there is still more to be added to the game in the near future. So when you make your space vesel and enter your galaxy try to "live long and prosper".

column8:
This game suffers just as much as it benefits from Early Access. A true Alpha build currently, this has yet to put together gameplay elements in a way that forms a game.
I'm loathe to recommend against it though, as the elements I'm seeing are exactly what I want this game to use, and once things come together this could easily be one of the top "Must Play" space explorations.
If you're willing to invest some time and money to test this, go for it. If you're looking for a good game that's just barely Early Access, try somewhere else.

column8:
I really want to like this game, but I'm still trying to figure out how to play it.  Ship design is neato.  There's subsystems that you assign to various parts, big ol' cannons, etc.  I just figured out how to get the shields into a design.  Finally having created a ship that would launch, I then popped into a very large area where some AI ship called me 'fresh meat.'  

I blasted away at what I thought was an enemy (after reading the help on the controls) .. brought his shields all the way down, and he didn't even return fire.  I wonder if he was an enemy?  Who knows!

Looking forward to more updates, but I shouldn't have bought it yet.

[i]Update -- The forums do have a ton of information.  Watching the tutorial videos helped a lot.  There's still a lot of work to do, but I'm changing my vote to a "Thumbs up if you don't mind betas" [/i]

column8:
First of all I may say that this game was a great surprise. When you start playing you will get stuck easily. You may think that the game isn´t worth but after playing couple of hours you discover the power of this tool.
That incredible capital ships you ve always dreamed of while watching star wars or star trek, now they will become real. Thanks to the 5 sized parts avaliable to combine you are able to design from the smallest fighter to the largest cruiser.
Even animation is not fully ended and enviroment needs developing, the experience of building ships is already enjoyable and quite fun.
Even being a game in alpha is a necessary game for those who enjoy not only space strategy but also a creative enviroment of fighting with your own ship.

column8:
EDIT 13th Jan 2018: 

This review used to be a thumbs up as it showed a ton of promise and the Early Access was fun, But alas the Dev's walked away. So Kinetic Void shall stay an unfinished project which could of been something fun. Do not buy this, There are better games similar to this that are actually finished or have a Dev Team commited to completing the Early Access of their game.


Original Review which was based on the Dev Team actually not giving up;

Kinetic Void - I originally bought KV for the ship building as I just enjoy playing Lego star ship building. Alas at the time I bought KV actually flying the ship was not that good, But!!........

 (EDIT 5th August 2014 : Dev Build 14 ship control is quite good, totally enjoying flying  my crazy designs)

Things have changed for the better as patches came along. Now its fun to get your creation made and out into the galaxy, Combat has come a long way since release, and I myself find it fun whilst I fly my ship and bombard the unsuspecting with my weapons. Oh and Combat drones actually do their job, nothing like seeing a wing of my drones attacking the enemies along with my ships weapon systems.

Building your ship, at times looks tedious. But its actually quite fun and simple once you understand its mechanics. There is a snap to grid type of mode and freehand mode for fine tuning a module of your ship for that certain look. I can literally spend all my time building a ship save it and begin another as I find it a ton of fun - It is my personal starship lego in my pc - Just a big kid at heart I think.

Mining has also came quite a long way, drone now mine the asteroids etc, harvesting ores for selling (A lot more to come I am sure on mining, buts its off to a good start)

Updates/patches come fast (I have noticed most Mondays there is an update) which shows the team dedication to KV. Some of the latest updates included some nice new backgrounds for the galaxies (Which I found to be excellent)

Dev support is quite good, I think this is one place where any game company (AAA or Indie) can excel or die from. Thankfully KV's team is quite good at letting the game players upto date on things coming and patch information. I myself have posted a comment or two and have had the Dev Team reply auite quickly on the topics  (This is something I look for in an Indie Team/Alpha release games - A+ guys/gals)

KV is still very alpha and most of us by now know what "alpha" means and if your unsure maybe wait a little longer, but I have not been disappointed with my purchase. KV has a long way to go with what is planned, but I think its going to be a fun ride as KV progresses into a full release.

I own pretty much every space game from Elite on C64 to the latest flop by a AAA developer, and all I can say is:

KV is another space game that I am happy to of added to my list of games I play each time I log into Steam.

If space games are your genre, I recommend adding this Indie title to you collection, for the price you will get your moneys worth out of it indeed!!!!

column8:
Ich hab mir das Game gekauft , aus dem Faszinieredem Grund -> Schiffe bauen. Nicht mehr und nicht weniger.
Wunschliste gepackt , gewartet bisses ne Aktion gab und dann gekauft.
Bin zufrieden , Schiffe bauen macht Spass ..bisschen rumfliegen fertig.Wer mal SPORE gespielt hatt und länger am bauen war weis was ich meine :).
Grafik ist gut , in diesem Spiel steckt potenzial. Entwickler bringen Updates , für den Einstieg gibts Tutorial Videos die ein paar sachen erklären.Das hier einige einen Titel negativ bewerten , weil sie trotz des des Hinweises "Early Access" immer noch ein Vollwertiges Spiel erwarten finde ich immer wieder kurios.
Also hier an dieser stelle auchnochmal . Dieses Spiel ist noch lange nicht fertig. Es gibt Bugs, Abstürze können auftreten , voller Funktions umfag ist nicht vorhanden !!
Ich persönlich warte gerne bisschen ab..Steam feuert genug Aktionen ab..und ein Spiel zu spielen während es sich entwickelt hatt auch was für sich.
column9:
I bought the game for the fascinating reason of building ships. Nothing more, nothing less.
I put it on my wishlist, waited until there was a sale, and then bought it.
I'm satisfied; building ships is fun...a bit of flying around, and that's it. Anyone who's ever played SPORE and spent a while building knows what I mean :).
Graphics are good, this game has potential. The developers are releasing updates, and for beginners, there are tutorial videos that explain a few things. I always find it strange that some people rate a title negatively because they still expect a full-fledged game despite the "Early Access" notice.
So, here it is again: This game is far from finished. There are bugs, crashes can occur, and the full range of functions isn't available!!
Personally, I like to wait a bit...Steam is firing off enough promotions...and playing a game while it's developing also has its advantages.

column8: interesting but long way to a perfect game
column9: interesting but long way to a perfect game

column8:
My previous review on this game was rather positive because it was fairly intriguing for an early access alpha.

The game is now released and not much has changed. This greatly disappoints me. Overall the gameplay isn't too bad (emphasis on too because it's not great either) but for a finished title it's aesthetically unpleasing. I'm Seriously disappointed this is considered a finished product. With the time you've had you could have achieved so much more from this.

Overall I give it a 4/10 mostly because it has a great ship builder and was generally a good early access experience but there is nothing else impressive about this game in its current state.

column8:
i have played this now for a few hours and as for as the ship building side of things go its a great game, sadly at this level of development thats all it is, i spent 2 hours building a capital class ship with massive firepower and was looking forward to testing it when i undocked and went to look around after 45 mins of flying around all i found was a single fighter. not much of a match, or a test.

in "story mode" it may just be me but flying around with that i was able to scrap together with what i started with was ok but working out how to make more money to upgrade said ship was beoynd me, not sure if there is away yet, but if there is its not obviouse, i blew up a few ships thining it was maybe on like a bounty system but no. and kills dont drop anything either so i left that and when back to just creative mode.

the only other thing i have to say thats negitive about it is the bug with faster speed, you are able to drop your kinetic barrier  (sheild) to gain more speed to move about faster, for me anything over a class 1 ship just droped my fraime rate to about 1fps. my rig is not small either, even when i droped all settings to very low it was the same i hope this is fixed later in a patch i know the devs seem to read the reviews as i saw alot of replies on the ones i read.

but to sum it up this game is very good if you enjoy deigning things. there is alot of potential for this to expand into a great sandbox builder. is it worth buying this early, personally yes if you liek to build things like i do, but if your looking for the roam around and kill stuff experience i would wait a little longer, altho saying that the more support they have early the faster things get done :) your choice, but it is a fun builder :)

column8:
Kinetic Void - Great ideas and concept, yet extremely unfinished and Work in Progress.

At this point in time KV is very much an early alpha - if it is even that. Consider waiting on a more finished version, unless you are a big fan of custom ship building and have little interest in actually using the ship in question.

Even the ship building itself is at this time incomplete. There is only one type of weaponry and many other critical features are still missing. The rate of update/patch progress is extremely slow.

From my point of view as a gamer, avoid KV for now, but keep an eye on it. IF, and I stress the word IF, all of the promised features are actually going to get implemented some time in the future, this could turn out to be a very cool space sim. However given the current rate of updates and the state of the game, I expect KV to be a project that will never end with a high likelihood of never getting to the finish line at all.

I believe this game can go far.

column8:
The only thing I can say about this game is that the name is appropriate, there is certainly a void here.  The game is void of content, void of gameplay, and void of meaningful updates.  

Maybe in a year or two the game will be ready to buy as an early access product.  

This game made me put a moratorium on buying an early access product, and I can't help but suggest you do the same right now.

column8: You can't save your progress yourself. The game does it for you sometimes. Then when you try to load your previous game it won't let you. The shipyard ship assembly should have a back/undo button so you can undo a mistake. Instead you sometimes end up erasing a module that you've spent time on when you selct something to edit and it erases the module connected to it as well. Then when you have  completed your ship and want to take it for a spin you are let out in the middle of nowhere. So you have to warp to get somewhere in order to interact with anything. As you enter warp the ship that you spent time constructing is shaken apart! But not to worry it is reconstituted as you exit warp though you may have difficulty recognizing the mangled mess that is your ship. This game is not ready for release. I wish I could get my money back and especially my time.

column8:
you spend a loving 2 hours perfecting your ship, giving it a vibrant color scheme to suit the style and how you play
(will i be the red pirate with quad guns all down the sides? will i be the ho hum grey mining ship? oh, the choices i have) and set off into the vast abyss that is the last (dare i say, final) frontier. you will see stars and planets and be immersed in a galaxy that is teeming and alive. even at early access this game is fantastic and at the sale price of 12.99, you cannot go wrong. 

don't get it twisted, this game is not finished. you will be running out of things to do at the current moment, but for me, im happy to just drift through space dictating my logs. that is until some asshole side swipes my ship and flies off. then i gotta fill out a space hit and run, and talk to the space cops, and they are always unhappy cause they just came back from a triple space homicide, and they just wanna go drink.... 

to make a long ramble short, buy this game, and enjoy.

column8:
UPDATED 7/8/2014
Since a number of people were asking me to re-review the game in its current state, I finally relented and decided to try the game again.  These are my thoughts.  

I find that many improvements have indeed been made.  This is to be expected, and very much welcomed.  I find that many of the features such as the shipyard and flight models have been improved with more easy-to-use controls and additional features.  A quick rundown of some of the key features and improvements I noticed:
* Better inter/intra-system navigation and map
* Slightly improved combat gameplay
* Improved flight model and warp systems
* Missions, Cargo, and semi-functional stores
* Semi-functional "career" mode.  More on this below.

Some things that are still issues:
* Not developer's fault, but many workshop ships no longer function out-of-the-box due to creators failing to update them for new patches.
* Overall, game still feels quite clunky and difficult to use.  Somewhat high learning curve unless you're wiling to read a lot.  
>> Documentation has been improved.  Just be prepared for lots of reading.  
* Crash to desktop is common.  Crashes more as your ship's # of modules increase
>> Relatively decent auto-save means you won't loose too much progress.
* See more below

The game is still quite confusing and you often still don't even know what's going on.  There's still a lot left to be desired I think.

Overall, the game has improved. Though I can't say that this is something to get especially excited about.  "Why are you being such a debbie downer" you ask?  Well, it's an alpha.  It is SUPPOSED to improve.  If it didn't, it's not worthy of even being sold.  

I still do not recommend this game.  There is a "But" however... Here are my thoughts

Many critical features have been added and improved to a more usable state.  The warp mechanism has been tremendously improved.  The shipyard build system also deserves a mention as a vast improvement.  More customizability and more controls to fine tune your construction.  Though this can make things a bit more confusing to the new person or returning player, as with some of the other expanded features.  This is made up for with the improved documentation.  But beware, decent amounts of reading is required.  There are also some tweaks and improvements to the combat system.  It makes more sense but can still be awkward.  The galaxy map has also gotten a big makeover and is MUCH easier to understand.  

There are many things that still are confusing and unfinished in this game.  The "career" mode is clearly unfinished and requires more attention.  From what I can tell, it's a misleadingly named "survival" mode at the moment.  However, it fails at that as well.  You have credits and the idea is to earn more through cargo or more "illigitimate" means. Basically, you start out by picking ANY ship from the workshop or stock selections.  No cost.  If you run out of money buying cargo to load into your mega-freighter you downloaded and didn't have to pay for, then just select any of the ship-part categories and sell any number of the "999" parts you somehow own from the start.  Just sell a couple Tier 5 weapons or ship bridges and you immediately have so much cash that the display has to use exponential notation (e.g. 1,000,000^E10).   

Verdict:  Not recommended.  The game is still definitely unfinished.  There is not much polish. While there are a number of great improvements, I still cannot justify this game as a purchase.  It's confusing for new/returning players unless you're a quick learner or wanna read all the documentation.  Without developer input, I estimate this game is less than 50% done; though considerably more than the 6% quoted by the dev around the time of my original review 7 months ago.  

My point still stands.  Do not buy the game unless you want to support the developer or really like the idea this game stands for.  It is playable now, so if you just really wanna get into space and do things, then go for it. I recommend waiting until a sale, however.  It is not worth $19.99 to me.  If it had a price-tag of about $10, it may be a good price if you're willing to put up with the downsides of a relatively mid-level-alpha.

ORIGINAL 1/15/2014
I don't recommend this game.  Yet.  If the features they have planned for this game come to pass, then this game will definitely be worth its price.   For now, I'd only recommend getting this on a Steam sale. This is a VERY early access with only a few of the main features added.  The building and customization functionality does have a lot going for it and has a lot of potential.  The rest of the game is still somewhat confusing, clunky, and still very clearly unfinished.

My advice?  Wait a while.  Or buy this game simply to support development of the game.  Buying it to play it may end you up with some serious disappointment.  Don't get me wrong though, as I said, this game has potential.  As the developer stated in another negative review, this game is only approximately 6% finished.  Do not expect much from it.

UPDATED 7/8/2014
Since a number of people were asking me to re-review the game in its current state, I finally relented and decided to try the game again.  These are my thoughts.  

I find that many improvements have indeed been made.  This is to be expected, and very much welcomed.  I find that many of the features such as the shipyard and flight models have been improved with more easy-to-use controls and additional features.  A quick rundown of some of the key features and improvements I noticed:
* Better inter/intra-system navigation and map
* Slightly improved combat gameplay
* Improved flight model and warp systems
* Missions, Cargo, and semi-functional stores
* Semi-functional "career" mode.  More on this below.

Some things that are still issues:
* Not developer's fault, but many workshop ships no longer function out-of-the-box due to creators failing to update them for new patches.
* Overall, game still feels quite clunky and difficult to use.  Somewhat high learning curve unless you're wiling to read a lot.  
>> Documentation has been improved.  Just be prepared for lots of reading.  
* Crash to desktop is common.  Crashes more as your ship's # of modules increase
>> Relatively decent auto-save means you won't loose too much progress.
* See more below

The game is still quite confusing and you often still don't even know what's going on.  There's still a lot left to be desired I think.

Overall, the game has improved. Though I can't say that this is something to get especially excited about.  "Why are you being such a debbie downer" you ask?  Well, it's an alpha.  It is SUPPOSED to improve.  If it didn't, it's not worthy of even being sold.  

I still do not recommend this game.  There is a "But" however... Here are my thoughts

Many critical features have been added and improved to a more usable state.  The warp mechanism has been tremendously improved.  The shipyard build system also deserves a mention as a vast improvement.  More customizability and more controls to fine tune your construction.  Though this can make things a bit more confusing to the new person or returning player, as with some of the other expanded features.  This is made up for with the improved documentation.  But beware, decent amounts of reading is required.  There are also some tweaks and improvements to the combat system.  It makes more sense but can still be awkward.  The galaxy map has also gotten a big makeover and is MUCH easier to understand.  

There are many things that still are confusing and unfinished in this game.  The "career" mode is clearly unfinished and requires more attention.  From what I can tell, it's a misleadingly named "survival" mode at the moment.  However, it fails at that as well.  You have credits and the idea is to earn more through cargo or more "illigitimate" means. Basically, you start out by picking ANY ship from the workshop or stock selections.  No cost.  If you run out of money buying cargo to load into your mega-freighter you downloaded and didn't have to pay for, then just select any of the ship-part categories and sell any number of the "999" parts you somehow own from the start.  Just sell a couple Tier 5 weapons or ship bridges and you immediately have so much cash that the display has to use exponential notation (e.g. 1,000,000^E10).   

Verdict:  Not recommended.  The game is still definitely unfinished.  There is not much polish. While there are a number of great improvements, I still cannot justify this game as a purchase.  It's confusing for new/returning players unless you're a quick learner or wanna read all the documentation.  Without developer input, I estimate this game is less than 50% done; though considerably more than the 6% quoted by the dev around the time of my original review 7 months ago.  

My point still stands.  Do not buy the game unless you want to support the developer or really like the idea this game stands for.  It is playable now, so if you just really wanna get into space and do things, then go for it. I recommend waiting until a sale, however.  It is not worth $19.99 to me.  If it had a price-tag of about $10, it may be a good price if you're willing to put up with the downsides of a relatively mid-level-alpha.

ORIGINAL 1/15/2014
I don't recommend this game.  Yet.  If the features they have planned for this game come to pass, then this game will definitely be worth its price.   For now, I'd only recommend getting this on a Steam sale. This is a VERY early access with only a few of the main features added.  The building and customization functionality does have a lot going for it and has a lot of potential.  The rest of the game is still somewhat confusing, clunky, and still very clearly unfinished.

My advice?  Wait a while.  Or buy this game simply to support development of the game.  Buying it to play it may end you up with some serious disappointment.  Don't get me wrong though, as I said, this game has potential.  As the developer stated in another negative review, this game is only approximately 6% finished.  Do not expect much from it.

column8: Ok, I have brought this on a whim awhile ago, one night I was going through games on steam I have bought but not played yet (ones I bought during a sale) I started building the ships and realized how in depth this game could become. This is early access and I was expecting an unfinished game, which it is... but the amount of potential this game has is crazy. That and the fact the developers pay attention to the people suggesting things on their message boards, really makes me happy I bought this now, because every update just makes this game better and i keep waiting for the new one to play it and see all the new things they put into the game. It does have bugs, but surprisingly nothing game breaking for this early in development. Right now i am writing this during a one day sale and suggest you buy it now, you wont regret it, unless this is not your type of game. If you like space games and building games, because the ship building mechanic is really fun by its self, it is probably something you are into.

column8:
Not without merit, but thoroughly mediocre. 

The good:
   The ship builder is the primary draw of this game- very versatile, can design whatever manner of ship you wish. The shipbuilder in Kinetic Void is more of a creative endeavour than anything else- unlike Kerbal Space Program, you do not need to worry about engineering constraints, efficiency, or performance very much. Perhaps that is appealing, perhaps not.

The matter of taste: 
   Even in campaign mode, the game is very very sandboxy. You are given very little direction, just let out into the galaxy and accosted by radio about missions. Absolute freedom, but absolutely no story or direction.

The ugly:
   This game is utterly lacking in polish. Campaign mode opens up with an interminable tutorial, a series of pop-up text boxes listing what each button does- this is not a good way to present information. The interface looks awful, combat is unexciting. Space is ugly, a starless void with only waypoints as defining features. It is an exciting concept with utterly mediocre execution.


TL:DR Buy this if you want to make model ships, or really like sandbox games

column8: The game has a solid idea, but I can't recommend it. The ship building premise is cool, music is great, graphics look fine. But in the end, there just isn't a whole lot to do. Perhaps this is a symptom of randomly generated maps and factions, but once you make your ship it becomes a boring, although quite pretty, sandbox. I think dev recommended numbers of systems and factions would help let players know the optimal amounts of each to keep gameplay exciting.

column8:
Once I had finally built a ship capable of travel at a reasonable speed, I immediately set about exploring. Unfortunately, my exploration didn’t yield a much asides from occasional distress calls from ships that moved too fast for me to do anything to help. The first (potential) release from Badland Studios has a lot of potential, but in its current incomplete state, Kinetic Void is nothing but confusing and frustrating.

For the segment on Kinetic Void. visit:

In KV, the first thing i like is the ship class.

Missiles
Lasers
Combat Ai
and so on.
The game already has a wide range of guns and cannons, making for a great mix and match.

I recommend this game, but please know its still early in development, so dont be too harsh on it.

column8:
Bear in mind this is still an incomplete game at this stage, so I will only review what feels like the most complete section, ship building.

Honestly I was a little hesitant at first, I have had other games where you can make your own content fail to deliver misserably, and I am a huge fan of making my own things my own way.
After getting to grips with placing the modules properly (which takes some time and mistakes) I completely forgot the time and before I knew it I had spent a whole evening making my first ship, which I was very proud of.

With some time and dedication you can make some fantastic creations with this even at this stage of development, it only takes a quick look on the workshop to see people who have made some really special things already, even a gaint mech!

This is already a fun game for those who enjoy the construction element in particular, the rest of the game is only really complete enough to take your creation for a joy ride and test out the fighting capabilities.
That said if the completed game has the same level of effort put in to its construction this could be a masterpiece waiting to happen...

Only buy at this point if you like games where you can make your own creations, and if you remember this is a game very much in development, do not expect a polished and complete experience yet!

column8:
I bought this game on sale six months ago and decided to let it stew and become more complete. Finally gave it a go today. It still reeks of incompleteness and a lack of anything to do. Space has never been more empty. I tried to pick a fight with one of the few ships I saw, but combat was confusing and not any fun.

This may be a good game some day. Heck, it may be a GAME some day. But this is early access at its purest; you're paying for something that isn't close to a release title. Don't touch until its finished, assuming that ever happens.

column8:
Kinetic Void is a stellar example of what many space related games should be.  Mind you while in early access many things are bound to change.  This game has a ship design system very akin to that used in Galactic Civilizations 2 which should be counted as a good thing.  The amount of customization that is offered to players in the design of their ships is a welcome sight as it’s something I have seen lacking in several games with the same feature.  From building the fastest fighter to the most looming dreadnought the experience of testing out different parts and experimenting with style is a great joy.

Players are allowed to name their galaxy and select how many sectors and factions exist within, giving them some level of control of the environment that they start off with.  There is plenty of room for expansion in this area of the game’s development as further options in creating the play environment would add to the overall experience.

The combat system is decent but could use some work.  While offering a manual mode of firing your ships weapons, there is a means of auto fire via the lock on, and pressing the assigned weapons group number.  In this early build I recommend avoiding the use of the auto fire as my weapons seemed resistant to firing let alone hitting.  However due warning, there does not appear to be any form of aim assist for now, and larger ships will have issues contending with smaller vessels you just cannot seem to hit.  (I am sure that these features will be ironed out in the future)

Other than that there really isn’t that much left to do within the game, yet currently you can see the foundations for what have the potential to be engaging and immersive systems.  

I full heartedly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys building ships from the ground up and actually being able to use them, as well as to anyone who enjoys space simulation games.  For what this game could be twenty dollars is a fair investment into seeing the developers get the chance to finish this game.  Yet to be fair it should be mentioned that in its current state Kinetic Void is arguably worth its asking price, while I love building ships and taking them for a spin there is just not enough to do currently.  With the occasional frame rate issue and bugs, for those on a budget or those who are not willing to drop twenty dollars on an incomplete game I would still recommend getting this game but when it is on sale.  This way you can still support the game, get a great ship builder, and access to what has the potential to be a great game.

column8:
Pas de multi alors qu'au début, c'était spécifié qu'il y en avait un.
On ne peu presque rien faire dans l'espace car pour passer d'une planette a l'autre il faut compter au moin une heur.
Himage du jeux un peu trompeur...
Au final c'est plus un jeux de légo ou on peut ensuite le metre dans l'espace...
les combats... il y a le tir auto ou le tir manuelle qui est pas trop mal mais l'IA est un peu conne... elle tourne en orbite autoure de notre vesseau en nous tirent deçue puis des foix elle se crash toute seul sur notre vesseau tel un moustique...
On ne peut pas aller sur les planettes, on se crash deçue, même pas d'animation, d'explosion... juste un retour dans notre menu.
Breff, si vous voulez un shipbuilder, il est bien mais il est tres limité mais c'est pas trop un jeux d'action.
column9:
No multiplayer, even though it was initially stated that there was one.
You can hardly do anything in space because moving from one planet to another takes at least an hour.
The image of the game is a bit misleading...
In the end, it's more of a Lego game where you can then put it in space...
The combat... there's auto-shooting or manual shooting, which isn't too bad, but the AI ​​is a bit stupid... it orbits our ship, shooting at us, disappointingly, and sometimes it crashes into our ship like a mosquito...
You can't go to the planets; you crash, disappointed, there's no animation, no explosion... just a return to your menu.
In short, if you want a shipbuilder, it's good, but it's very limited, but it's not really an action game.

column8: Looks really promising--the building is deep but not terribly difficult. With polish and the promised features this could be a true masterpiece. At current, it's still great fun for creative types and though the combat (one of the few features of actual spaceflight at current) is very rough around the edges, it seems like it will be polished into a quality sim. I'm really looking forward to every update.

column8:
It's a trap! No, I'm not trying to be funny. This "game" is not what is pretends to be, It's an utter waste of time. It's not an "Adventure", it's a ship designer. That part works, but please do not spend hours wasting time on that, because once you've built your ship you can't really do anything with it. Twenty bucks for that?

Maybe you should buy it if only to learn a valuable lesson about Early Access: NO REFUNDS.

column8:
Development stopped or stalled on this shell of a game. Looking back through change logs of this game since it's release, there seem to be no improvements in actual gameplay, which is to say, there isn't any gameplay. If you manage to launch your pre-fabbed ship into the 'void' without freezing your computer solid, you've experienced all this game has to offer. If the idea of shp building is what appeals to you, try Kerbal Space Program, or Space Engineers. Both early access Steam games with ship building AND gameplay.
I understand early releases are made for playtesting and refinement, but there is nothing to play or test here.

column8:
alright im redoing this review because there was an update recently that fixed some of the issues with the game. the game performs much better now and the interface has also improved.

it is much easier to install parts into your creations and build ships. though certain things are seperated out so if you want to install armor onto ALL your turrets you have to select them all individually same with your engines

 once you get into open space my framrate doesnt tank as badly as it once did. now it only tanks when im being swarmed by enemies and my turrets attempt to lock onto them. also framerate tanks whenever i open the map screen which is weird.

the building is first rate but the combat is based upon a turret system so if you want to actually control the weapons you have to press an auxilary button to fire them yourself. otherwise all the weapons feel really piss weak with no noticible difference between the large and small weapons in terms of damage though the smaller ones usually fire faster. the automated targeting with the weapons is rather slow and you can find your systems overloaded if you mark to many targets at once. even then i have had times when i have marked just one target and though its still within range they wont actually fire at the enemies.

can i recommend it now. on gameplay no. the menus have gotten better so i can recommend the game on that.

column8:
Good space game with some physics and FULLY customizable ships. Vast universe with solar systems.
This game is a perfect combination of realistic space and good gameplay. There is not many games if any that have these parameters. Some have very realistic space physics (like KSP), some has very detailed ship designs. This game is a perfect combination of a lot of space simulators. You can say, that they have found a balance when the game is very detailed and still very fun to play.

column8:
The ship customization is certainly promising but at the stage of development I played it, I couldn't even figure out how to start a ship's engines without rifling through several videos on YouTube. 

And quite frankly Star Citizen has made millions of dollars simply by crowd funding, including $100 of my own at this point. So I don't see how this game will ever take off with such a titan on the horrizon of space simulators, especially when it seems this game wont be in a playable state anytime soon.

Of course I own a copy of the game now, so whenever it is released I'll muck about with the game at that time and change this review accordingly. But for now, I'd advise you to just go toss your money at Chris Roberts' face because he's awesome and stuff.

column8:
UPDATE /// 8-22-14
Game as far as construction of ships is far more functional than when I first got the game if not buggy and great strides have been made in this area to make it approachable. However once you get into the game itself the fundimental problems with the game shine through again.  

Kinetic Void tries to reinvent the space sim wheel by making it square.  Controls are overly complicated for flight and space feels empty. Both of these problems have been solved by games made over a decade ago like Freelancer. Mouse flight needs to be implemented better. Warp gates need to be added to define sections of space. Weapons need to feel more powerful and stand out more. Procedural galaxies need to be dropped and replaced with a designed galaxy unless they can make them interesting which they currently are not. I could go on and on about how this game ignores problems that have been solved by older, better games.

My suggestion... save your money. Early Access games either have good bones that need to be fleshed out or they're like Kinetic Void where all they have is a good idea but no idea how to impliment it into a good game.

---------------------------------------

This game is garbage it's barely even a game at the moment. I wish I could get my money back. :(

column8:
I would recommend this game for most people, but not everyone. I have watched this game grow (and continue to do so) since July 2013 and am pleased by the progress that the developers have made so far, but there is still much work to be done in order to refine Kinetic Void. I would recommend this game to the following types of gamers:

-Gamers who enjoy being creative in taking parts and building something of their own, but poses the patience to have to tweak, rework, or even recreate what they make after major patches come out. This game is still early access so it is understandable that these things happen and the patches generally make things easier.

-People who enjoy a good RPG type simulation that takes place with ships, factions, and fleets, and can spend hours upon hours of trial and error to find out what works best in this game.
 
-People who have ever played Battlestar Galactica Online: the game has a similar feeling to it and I feel that people who enjoyed that MMO would feel right at home with Kinetic Void outside of the ship creation menu

-Peoplewho have played and enjoyed Kerbal Space Program: If you enjoyed the building mechanics in Kerbal, expect to enjoy Kinetic Void

-People with a lot of patience in general who can wait for something to blossom to its true potential.

I won’t lie, this game still has a lot of bugs (some are actually quite comical) but the Developers have done a good balance of both fixing these bugs as they come up and adding new content to the game, and I hope they continue to do so.

column8: The game, as it is right now, is a ship builder. It is still in alpha and there should be more to come (I hope) but so far what i've seen of just the ship building has been worth the money I spent. Not only can you build a full ship from bits and pieces but also install subsystems into each part that you use to build the ship. If the rest of the game has as many options as the builder did, I think it may even beat the X3 series. Alpha Rating: 7/10

column8:
This is probably the most realistic space simulation I have ever played. 
You spend a really long time designing the perfect spaceship, equipped with high tech engines, weapons, cargo holds, medical bays, mess halls, crew quarters, and reactor cores. You believe you're prepared for anything space has to offer, whichso far, isn't very much. 
Akin to NASA, the Developers are going to need a lot more funding before anything new can be discovered in the final frontier.

column8:
DON'T  BUY THIS GAME RIGHT NOW!!!
Even than the core idea seems interesting, the game is in so early development phase that there is no fun of any kind.
The key feature of this game is the possibility of to design and to build your own customized ship from scratch.
Other key feature is the randomization of galaxies but, it seems you have nothing to do with planets, there is no interaction.
Engine is a hard CPU consuming and doesn't seem to be optimized.
Lot of hours flying in a void space, where nothing happens.
Lack of history board, or goals or missions.
No user's manual. No key bindings. Weak user interface.
Map does nothing for you. You never know where your ship is and, which is the distance to any potential target (except if they are in your range).
Making it short, this 'game' needs a HUGE effort before it can be called a game.

column8:
EDIT: The game is out of Early Access now. For me, I encounter a game breaking graphical bug (Linux specific) that is unlikely to be fixed. Unfortunately, as I cannot play it, I cannot recommend the game any more. In addition, the gameplay has been changed from what I prefered, with Newtonian-ish physics only present when your shields are down, making it near useless for combat.

This game allows the player to build their own ship of any size and design (unless if you don't pick creative mode, in which case you will have to earn your parts), fly it anywhere in a massive procedurally generated galaxy, and interact with other factions along the way. The ultimate in futuristic space simulation.

This is an early access game and is currently in an early alpha, with frequent updates.

column8:
Basically a 3rd person space flight simulator, but with some very interesting twists. Most notabely the ability to design your own space ship, designs which NPC's are known to use as well, to keep the playing field balanced.

Add to that relational status with numerous factions and reasonably large universe (can be set upon creating one) and you have yourself a great arena to test these designs in. Don't have an enemy? Create one by just randomly shooting ships that happen to pass by. You could always go mining or salvaging derelict craft for resources as well.

Great graphics and awesome soundtrack, easy to learn controls, but sometimes not so clear on what, though optional, you mission objectives are make this a nice addition to any collection.

There are some problems though, crashes, editor that has trouble doing certain things, but nothing really game breaking. And although I'm not much of a multiplayer gamer, I can see some real potential in that latest addition as well.

Bare in mind though that this is still an project in development.
column9:
Basically a 3rd person space flight simulator, but with some very interesting twists. Most notabely the ability to design your own space ship, designs which NPC's are known to use as well, to keep the playing field balanced.

Add to that relational status with numerous factions and reasonably large universe (can be set upon creating one) and you have yourself a great arena to test these designs in. Don't have an enemy? Create one by just randomly shooting ships that happen to pass by. You could always go mining or salvaging derelict craft for resources as well.

Great graphics and awesome soundtrack, easy to learn controls, but sometimes not so clear on what, though optional, you mission objectives are make this a nice addition to any collection.

There are some problems though, crashes, editor that has trouble doing certain things, but nothing really game breaking. And although I'm not much of a multiplayer gamer, I can see some real potential in that latest addition as well.

Bare in mind though that this is still an project in development.

column8: Kinetic Void is a fantastic space exploration game. You can build your ship and you are only limited by your imagination (oh and the part list) but it still gets the job. column8:
It saddens me immensley to say this.... The game is escentially dead. The dev, for all we know, ran off his own team, spent the money on a bunch of other games, and seemed to give up on KV completely.

The game is dead-- please.... Please, don't get this game. I beg of you, don't. There's nothing more for it to offer.... Not anymore...

I'm sad now.


Also, I asked the dev what went wrong. All I wanted was an update saying "Sorry for the lack of updates, life happened and now [insert excuse here]." But he refused and banned me from the forums for saying it hurts that he won't tell us anything anymore. Do NOT buy this game. The dev is a dirty as my back yard.

column9:
First of all, it's a disgrace that this game is still being sold on Steam after more than five years. They're just fucking criminals.

Not even a pre-alpha, and they're already dead. Once again, a software corpse has been fed money. Next time, I'd rather eat it myself. Bye!

column8:
4 years ago I wrote this review of Kinetic Void:
"This is still in Alpha, so its buggy and lacks a lot of features, but from the last few updates, this is shaping up to be an awesome freeform space-sim with badass shipbuilding mechanics and a really great design team."

And at the time, that all seemed true.  But 4 years later and this is one of the clearest examples of the dissappointments  related to early access games.  This game seems like it has been pretty much abandoned by its developers and I honestly cannot recommend this game.

column8:
"Early Alpha, it's pretty rough right now but it's updated on an almost daily basis.  If you like space games, get this now!"

That was me, back in 2013 (I think) when this game was new on Steam.  I played it for a while, but eventually got bored and forgot about it, because there wasn't much to do after building your ship.  Several years later, that's still the case, and apparently the Developer has abandoned the game.  Don't even buy this trash on sale.
